description:
Searched Yelp for Thai and come up with this place, close by. We started with the Murder Wings and Prawn Rolls, to compliment our icy cold IPA and Amber. Dinner was a shared dish called Khao Soi. It was so dang tasty!! Dessert was the special  FBI Fried Bananas & Ice Cream. Go with the Buka (coconut) and experience a heavenly finish to a delicious meal.

The service was outstanding, and since we sat right next to the kitchen, our food was piping hot, the way it's supposed to be.

We also noticed that about every five minutes, there was some sort of food delivery service coming in the back door to pick up an order. It was like a revolving door. Obviously people know this place is Great.

Good Job, Ben Thai!!
author: Doug C.

description:
Ben Thai has great choices, a clean and hip atmosphere and quick service. 

We really enjoyed our meal, but some of the fried items were very greasy. The seating is limited and the tables are small. 

The Golden Bags are delicious as is the yellow curry. Portions are on the small to moderate size. The flavors were all great and everything came out hot, but our meals didn't come out together. The Thai iced tea was a bit watery and when they get busy it's noisy and hard to find your server. 

I would come back again, the food was good and the problems minor. The food did taste freshly prepared.
author: Bianca U.

description:
This place was delicious! My husband and I were recently in Thailand and after a few months of detox, we started having cravings for the delicious cuisine again. We had some pretty high standards after spending so much time in Thailand, but we were pleasantly surprised because every dish we tried here brought us back to the local restaurants abroad. All of the flavors were on point, and I was really happy that they had Khao Soi since not a lot of Thai places up here have that Northern Thailand dish. 

One thing I wasn't the biggest fan of was their prices. Not trying to compare it to prices in Thailand of course, but just compared to restaurants in South Bay, this place was on the pricier end for some of their items (Khao Soi & Thai Iced Tea).. but I guess given its location and average Thai food prices in the area, this place is pretty average (so I guess my general advice is to not eat Thai food in SF if you had a choice... haha). My husband and I ordered their Murder Wings ($9.50), Khao Soi ($16), Crab Fried Rice ($16), Pa-nang ($13), BBQ Pork ($13), and Thai Iced Tea ($4.... FOUR DOLLARS FOR A THAI ICED TEA). If I do decide to splurge on Thai food and go back, I'd get the Khao Soi, Crab Fried Rice, and BBQ Pork again. 

Ok, I'm docking off a star because of their service. 1) They were not the fastest. We were the only other party there besides someone finishing up their food, and our dishes still came out pretty slowly. Can't imagine how it is with a full house. 2) We went at 5:30PM (during their happy hour) so their appetizers were $1 off, but when we got the check they didn't apply the discount. Not sure if this was because we also applied the 50% off non-alcoholic beverages yelp check-in coupon to our Thai tea's, but it's more so the principle that I'm annoyed with because they didn't give us a heads up... We didn't notice until after they swiped our card so we let it go but just FYI.. pay attention to your bill.. they sneaky.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Great Thai place on Polk. We came in right as it opened at 11:30 on a Sunday. Comfortable restaurant, with cool dragon art and two separate rooms for diners.

We got the pad thai, which had slightly thicker noodles than most places. Nice wok hei, and it was a hefty portion.

We also got one of the specials, which was listed as a Chinese dish made by the owner's mom. Big chunks of pork belly stewed with pickled veggies, lettuce, and hard boiled eggs. Very tasty and we didn't even finish. Doesn't come with rice, so we got an order of white to accompany and it came shaped like a heart.

Ben Thai seems big on the flourishes, and my husband's Thai ice coffee came with a paper rose on the straw.

Cute place, and definitely would return. Good beer selection as well.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Came here with two of my friends for our last dinner in San Francisco! We walked in and was seated by a friendly server. After looking through the menu, my friends and I went a little crazy and ordered a bunch of food! We ordered the Golden Bags, Tom Yum Soup with Prawns, Beef Pad Kee Mao, Beef Pad Thai, Beef Panang Curry, and Mango & Sweet Sticky Rice. We also ordered Thai Iced Tea, Thai Iced Coffee, and alcoholic beverages. We were probably thinking, "Go hard or go home!" 

The Tom Yum Soup came out first and our server put them in our bowls for us. My friends and I loved it! The Golden Bags came out shortly after and looked awesome. It looked awesome, but I felt as if it was stuffed with too much potatoes and too little chicken. Nothing too special.

The entrees took a bit while to come out, but we were hanging out with our drinks and chit chatting. When the food came out, our server asked us if we wanted rice with our Panang Curry. It usually comes with rice at other Thai restaurants, so that was an automatic yes from us. He came out with 3 bowls, but that came at a price! We ordered a lot of food, so I wished he took that into consideration (it's okay, it's our last dinner in SF). All entrees were delicious with the perfect amount of heat! After we were completely stuffed, our server took our plates and asked us if we were ready for our Mango & Sweet Sticky Rice. This took a while to come out like our entrees, but the presentation made up for it! The rice was in the middle with thin slices of mango shaped like a heart around it!

Overall, this place is a solid Thai restaurant in San Francisco! Thai food is normally a bit more on the pricey side, but you will always leave stuffed and satisfied!
author: Anthony N.

description:
This place was just "okay" in my book. Been to a lot of better Thai restaurants but also been to worse ones too. The service was okay. A tad slow but not horribly slow. 

The Thai iced tea wasn't as strong in flavor as I like it to be. My companion ordered some kind of chicken skewers and they were mediocre. Again, not terrible, but I had one and wasn't dying for another. 

I ordered the Crispy Duck Curry for my entree and I was a little disappointed. The reviews here on Yelp really hyped me up for this dish but it was meh. The duck was very fatty and I really didn't think the skin was that crispy. I also didn't care much for their red curry- I wanted spicier and more of a depth of flavor there. 

I had the mango and sticky rice for dessert. That was very yummy. All in all, just an okay experience. If I wanted Thai again in downtown San Fran, I would def try one of the many other options.
author: Cynthia D.

description:
Great lunch spot with big lunch special portions. 

Gra Prao - my go too every time I get Thai. Delicious here. 5 stars. 

Spicy eggplant with pork - 5 stars. 

Spicy tilapia - 4 stars great flavor but a little dry 

$10-$15 per person for lunch special which is reasonable. The restaurant was clean and nice but on a part of Polk St you don't expect to pay $15 for lunch.
author: Dave K.

description: Good good. Slow service. I dont think I'd come back here unless they changed that. The ambience is unimpressive.
author: Arjan N.

description: Everyone know I love me some Thai Food! So I've ventured off in my new neighborhood to test out them. This spot is yummies, and portion size was enough for lunch the next day....
author: Carol V.

description:
Never actually dine in at the restaurant but often order to go.

Ben Thai has been our to go Thai food place since we live so close. They offer an array of Thai dishes but we always go for the Tom Yum Soup. Their soup is very rich in flavor. The to go system is a breeze, you can call in, or order on yelp, but we usually do the calling. 

Please be aware, they don't offer you a bag unless you pay so bring your own bag to carry your to go home.
author: Maria H.

description:
Neighborhood restaurant for locals.  A little bit divy.  Far from the tourist path.  Went there by finding them on Yelp and got there just in time before closing.   Food was very tasty and much more authentic than regular Thai food at more Americanized restaurants.  

The service was very good and the prices reasonable.  The interior is very Plain.
author: Furrokh I.

description: Walked in for dinner on a weekday and it wasn't super busy but it filled up fast and there were lots of takeout orders too. A check-in on yelp gets you half off on a homemade drink. I'm guessing soda isn't included in that category. But probably thai tea and we got the ginger lemonade. It's very ginger-y, like burn your throat gingery. We had to water it down with the tap water. So be forewarned. I got the pad see ew with pork and the bf got the prao-grao fried rice with beef. I was starving when I there and the portions didn't look that big. But I was stuffed halfway through and ended up taking the rest home for lunch the next day. My pad see ew was simple but cooked well. The noodles are on the thinner side, from what I'm normally used to.  But it was still good. And the amount of pork they put in there was proportional to the noodles. Only like 5-6 stalks of broccoli though. I could've used more. I only had a bite of the fried rice. It was a little too spicy for me. But the bf liked it and scarfed it all down. Both dishes were about $12-13. A little more than I want to pay but it is SF. Solid thai entrees.
author: Alison W.

description: Good food and service. Food tasty but a little on the heavy side. Packed when we got there. Wish there was more protein with the noodle entree, otherwise satisfied. I saw everyone order a coconut reddish soup but it looked very heavy so it turned me off. Wings were hyped but just ok.
author: Elizabeth N.

description: Great food. The pad Thai was excellent. The crab pancake was not great. Pad Kee Mao was also great (pretty spicy, good flavor). The portions were huge, we took a lot of food home with us. Service was also good and the food came out fairly quickly. Overall we were pleased. Being from out of town, and not having many good Thai restaurants at home, Ben Thai cafe beat our expectations.
author: Andy S.

description: This is the original Thai restaurant that made me fall in love with Thai food! Even though this location has recently changed ownership, the food is fantastic and the staff know us by name! I highly recommend the pad Thai with shrimp and a coconut! They literally serve you a cut-open a coconut! I love it!
author: Jessica Y.

description:
We were looking for a place to get a small late dinner when I stumbled upon Ben Thai on Yelp. Let me tell you, I'm so glad I did. The prices are fair and the food is fantastic. 

I didn't think I could find a better Thai place than Oros in San Jose but their Pad Thai is legendary. We ordered the Pad Thai and Spicy Eggplant with basil and they were both so good. The portions for the Pad Thai was HUGE and I didn't expect a size like that from a restaurant in SF. They also had a deal on Yelp where you get a housemade drink for 50% off and I got the Thai Iced Tea. The Thai Iced tea was authentic, the spicy eggplant was flavorful and the Pad Thai was the best Pad Thai I have ever had. The noodles were perfectly cooked and the flavor went perfectly together. 

The service was also super friendly and fast. We came in about and hour and half before closing and the restaurant was more than half full with only one server. We thought that might be an issue but one server did a better job than most restaurants do with multiple servers. I highly recommend Ben Thai to anyone in SF.
author: Nancy T.

description:
The thai place i return to over and over again! A bit pricey, but worth the money. So tasty. 

Murder wings were worth trying. I'm not a fan of lemongrass though. Pad khee mao and pad thai are always on point here. Perfectly cooked noodles! Great chef specials as well.

Clean, modern interior, and always an interesting selection of local draft beers available. Fast and great service.
author: Jennifer M.

description: This place was amazing! I came here with three other people for lunch, and we all left very happy! The server was very helpful and pleasant. We ordered the pad thai, the green curry, the pad see ew, and the chicken satay. The food came out quickly, and everything tasted amazing. I will definitely come back next time I want thai food!
author: Kelsey L.

description:
The Pad Thai was a bit disappointing. It lacked flavor. Unfortunately, there were no sauces or salt on the tables to help salvage this dish.

Luckily the Pad Kee Mao was much more satisfying. The noodles were flavorful and had a bit of heat (spiciness).

Both dishes were ordered vegetarian, so came with fried tofu. It tasted ok, but there were only three or four pieces in each dish.

Given this lackluster first experience, on the fence on whether to return to try other dishes.
author: David W.

description: Quick service and friendly staff! The food was pretty aunthentic tasting and came out very fast. I tried a few popular things I saw in yelp and the food did not disappoint. Would recommend and come back to try different things on the menu!
author: Stephanie A.

description: I went because of great Yelp reviews but it wasn't anything great. Food was good, nothing outstanding and the order came in 50 minutes after we came in. Ambience needs a check too. I saw flies inside.
author: Japna C.

description:
Ben Thai Cafe is not to be missed! Tried it for the first time this past Friday when Baba had massive cravings for Thai food.

Baba had the beef pad thai while I had to try their ka-ree as it's one of my favorite Thai dishes. Baba loved the pad Thai, light and flavorful. I loved my dish, one of the first I've had with pumpkin and red potatoes. Chicken was plentiful, tender and flavorful.  Washed it all down with a great glass of Thai iced coffee!

The service was extremely friendly, even when I had to walk up to correct a mistake I made to my order. I can't remember the last time I ordered food and it was fresh at my table in under 10 minutes during dinner rush on a Friday! This team is on top of their game, that's for sure!

I can't wait to come back!!
author: Hala A.

description:
We weren't able to find anything about if dogs are allowed here. I had my small Maltese yorkie with me and they let us come in :) 

The food was great. We got the BBQ pork, green curry with beef, pad Thai with shrimp and two sides of rice. 

The pad Thai wasn't spicy at all I think next time I would ask for a little spice to be added. The green curry was spicy!! I love spicy so it wasn't a problem for me. But one of the people we were with didn't like spicy it was too hot for her liking. 

The BBQ pork was amazing. It was sweet and spicy and just the right amount of crunch to it. 

It was $60 for 4 of us and my friend and I got the Thai iced tea (with the 50% off yelp coupon for non alcoholic drinks) and my husband got the sangria. 

Not a bad price and we left satisfied :)
author: Meghan P.

description: We went to the Cafe for lunch. They have a lunch menu as well as a varied regular menu, with many items one would not expect. My wife chose Prem-Pan, like an Indonesian Gado-Gado with peanut-sauce, augmented with beef-strips. I had the oxtail soup. Both were excellent and we expect to return to try other dishes. Service was very friendly. They place is modern and clean.
author: Gio W.

description: Super yummy Thai food! We got the yellow curry, pad kee mow and the Khao suey (all vegetarian). I would say the yellow curry was my favorite! The pad kee now was also super flavorful! The khao suey was something I have never tried before (noodles in a red curry with crispy bits) and was pretty good! I also got the honey ginger lemonade (thanks yelp for the drink discount!) will definitely be back to try more (I have my eye on the murder wings)
author: Rachel N.

description:
Pros: Came here during the middle of the Halloween Pub Crawl for dinner and surprisingly it wasn't crowded considering they're located so close to Playland. We were seated pretty quickly and it was fun to see the staff also partaking in the Halloween spirit by dressing up as well. One of the waiter accidentally dropped a full glass of water next to me and he was very apologetic and cleaned everything up really quick. Good for large groups too!

Cons: If you're a hungry guy, the portion size might not be enough for you but for me it was exactly the right amount. 

Ordered: Egg noodles with curry (not sure what the exact name of it). Super satisfying! Craving it right now as I right this review.

Would I recommend: Yes, check this place out if you're drinking on Polk Street or take a date out. Restaurant is pretty nice and the staff was great.
author: Terry N.

description:
Accidentally stumbled on this cute lil Thai place while apartment hunting around Polk street. 
I was not very hungry ( apartment hunting killed my appetite) and hence ordered Pork in the heaven with sticky rice.. It is the best fried pork I have had in a while. It's so flavorful. Loved the use of whole coriander seeds on them. 

My husband ordered Penang Curry Chicken. It was amazing as well. He said the veggies were cooked just right retaining its freshness & crunch.! 

Used the yelp check in order to have a glass of ginger honey lemonade.. it hit the right note for me.. however, my husband was not a fan of it. All in all a good find. Definitely coming back!
author: Prarthana P.

description: Had the pad Thai and Thai tea. Pretty decent eats and the staff was really kind. Only minus was that the tea wasn't sweet enough for my liking. All and all still good eats.
author: Nikki W.

description:
Delicious lunch here on a Sunday.

We came as soon as the placed opened for dinner service. We weren't the only ones to arrive shortly after just opening.

I ordered the duck curry and my date also ordering a noodle soup.

For drinks I ordered the ginger, honey, and lime/lemonade and a fresh baby coconut as well.

Everything was great! 

The curry wasn't too thick and not too savory. Plus the  duck, the duck was fatty and greasy which is what I  love. 

I really like the soup that we ordered. It was slightly spicy, slightly creamy, just a little sour.  Kao soi. 

The wait staff very attentive. My glass was always full. 

Next time I'll have to try the meal worms. This is probably the first restaurant I've seen to have that served and offered on their menus around here.
author: A Z Flor H.

description: Serving staff seemed a little distracted during the dinner rush but hands down the best Khao Soi I've had outside of Thailand! I'll be coming back here the next time I'm in town. My compliments to the chef!
author: Aaron M.

description: If you like Thai food, this place is a must. It's a great lunch and dinner spot. The menu isn't as extensive as some of the other Thai spots around Tenderloin, but it's fewer dishes, done well. I highly recommend the Khaosoi and the duck noodle soup. The KJ Noodle Soup is also very authentic and good. I just recently came back from Chiang Mai, so it was nice to find a place in SF that serves very authentic and tasty Khaosoi.
author: Billy S.

description:
Based on the great reviews, I had high expectations that were maybe a tad too high.

Pros:
- Yellow curry was tasty, I like the unique addition of squash. Heat level was perfect.
- Our toddler wouldn't eat anything on the table and our amazing server brought some carrot sticks and oranges to occupy her. 

Cons:
- The beef in our pad see ew was all but inedible. It was soooo chewy. I noticed it was cut with the grain so whoever is in the kitchen doesn't know how to slice beef.
- The Thai tea was over brewed and bitter, yet watered down. Literally the worth Thai tea I've ever had.
author: Rachel U.

description:
Found this place by reading yelp reviews. I had the gang dang curry with chicken with brown rice. The red curry sauce was exceptional and the rice was a great accompaniment. The pad kee mao with chicken had great flavor and the green curry with beef and eggplant was delicious. 
Great food at a very reasonable price.
author: Shawnie M.

description: Good food and huge portions at a great price. Sketchy part of town and inside is a little tight but if you're hungry and craving Thai make the trip.
author: Henry B.

description: I called ahead to order my food and it was hot and ready when I got there. I got the pad thai which was delicious and my friend got the murder wings which were very well marinated. I wish the wings were a bigger portion but it was still very tasty. The thai tea was delicious and not too sweet. I would have hoped to have more because it's my favorite drink. The gentlemen that served us was a sweetheart and I was recommend this place to everyone. :)
author: Crisia S.

description:
We had dinner - two Khao soi and a Yellow Curry. All were excellent. Veg variety in the khao soi was good and the broth was very flavorful. Our friend likes spicy and liked the spice level.

Portions were a good size. Others around us got the paid Thai which looked like a huge portion. 

Small space. Good service.
author: A B.

description:
The restaurant itself is really nice looking. In and out. I ordered the Chicken wings because on the menu it says they are to die for. Well I wouldn't go quite that far. the wings tasted really great. But there was hardly any meat on the bone. Kind of disappointing really. My eating companions really enjoyed their plates. I know this place is spectacular. I just wish my wings were a little meatier. 

I'm sure I will give this place another try.
author: Kat D.

description: Guess I've had a lot of good Thai food in the Bay Area, this place didn't cut it. The murder wings were pretty average. Had a basil chicken dish, it didn't have too much flavor. Also, the Thai iced tea was just average.
author: Vinayak P.

description:
TLDR - Solid food but more interesting for its regional Thai and other Asian dishes than its standard Thai dishes

Stopped by for dinner one night, mainly because I wanted to try the mealworms, which I haven't seen at any other Thai restaurant in SF. Since bugs/mealworms are something you're more likely to find in Thailand than in the US, I thought maybe that meant the food here would be more authentic, but it was pretty much your standard Thai restaurant.

The menu isn't as extensive as more authentic Thai spots, comprising mostly of your typical dishes, but at least that makes it less overwhelming to order. They do have some "family favorites" though, which intrigued me more, like oxtail soup, squid, khao soi and duck noodle soup.

My friends and I got the Mealworms to share as an appetizer and I ended up going with the Oxtail Soup (American Thai).

* MEALWORMS ($7) - 4.5/5
I was expecting these to be a crunchy fried texture, but they were actually soft with a slightly crisp exterior. Yes they look gross, but honestly if you're Asian, you've probably eaten some pretty weird things. Nicely salted and served with crispy basil leaves that gave it a little more flavor.

* OXTAIL SOUP ($15) - 4/5
Huge portion and very generous with the oxtail! Incredibly tender and somewhat fatty. Definitely a rich, hearty soup. I actually would've liked more veggies in the soup to balance it out. Nothing really Thai about the flavor but still tasty.
author: Jessie L.

description:
Generally when I'm on this section of Polk Street, I end up walking to Lers Ros for my Thai food fix.  However, I've been to Ben Thai a few times now, and I've always left feeling happy with my decision.  During my last visit, I could tell that this place was popular as there was a bit of a wait.    

In general, I think I've been more impressed with the appetizers compared to the entrees.  I tried the pork of the heavens during my first visit and loved the sweet and savory flavor of the meat combined with the sticky rice.  The golden bags expertly combine a crispy wrapper with a fluffy potato and chicken filling.  In terms of the entrees, my favorite item has probably been the Khao Soi, which was a curry soup chock full of noodles, meat, pork skin, shallots, and onions. 

Service is friendly, and if you use your Yelp check-in, you can get half off on non-alcoholic drinks.  I would definitely visit again if I was in the area.
author: Keith H.

description:
One advantage of having a thai roommate is knowing a good Local Thai place..

This place surely pass his pallet..

Got 3 food orders today ..

My new favorites that you hardly see on other Thai Place is Kao Sao dish  (northern part of Thailand kind of noodle..try it it's Good
author: Donovan L.

description: I came here with my family for a late dinner, and it did not disappoint! The food here seemed pretty authentic and the service was great! It seems like a small hole in the wall restaurant, but when you step inside, you can't resist! I ordered the roasted duck curry with white rice, and it was the most amazing thing I've had! The duck was very tender with great flavor and seasoning. Never had duck that tender before! My brother ordered the paradise wings and they were also quite flavorful. This place is on the more pricey side when you compare it to the portions of the entrees, but it was definitely worth making a visit to.
author: Han P.

description: Service is efficient, and the food is definitely nice and wholesome. If you're looking to get a fairly quick but filling lunch, this is the place to go. I recommend getting the "Murder Wings"; don't let the name intimidate you. It's not as spicy as you think, and it has a great blend of flavors.
author: Yuki W.

description: The food here is so good... Hard to fault them if the service is sometimes very slow.  This has supplated Farmhouse as my go-to Thai restaurant.  Give it a shot!
author: Jeremy B.

description: I would come again. Prices are good food is good too. I ordered 2 lunch specials to go and they didn't have the salad but I wasn't sure if that was supposed to be because the communication is short. Lemon grass in Tom yum gah soup was hard, maybe because i ate it a few days later though? Thai tea is more watery than some other places. Overall it's great for the price.
author: Cindy L.

description: The pad thai is good, and the hot tea nurturing. Simple, yet filling. The service, great!
author: Gaya G.

description:
We came on a Friday night, but only had to wait 3 minutes before being seated. We started with the larb salad, which came to the table with a very strong scent. Being Filipino I am no stranger to fish sauce, but this sucker was potent! We gobbled it all up, but we just wish there was a little less fish sauce. Our next dish was the crab pancake, which was excellent. Perfectly crispy on the edges with a chewy middle and crunchy bean sprouts. Definitely an excellent dish to share as a starter. For our entree we split the gra-prao fried rice with pork. I'm not one to usually order fried rice, but since I picked the first two dishes, my fiance chose this one. I liked this dish way more than I thought I would. It was very flavorful and the rice was the prefect texture and not mushy. I just wish we added an extra sunny egg on the top so we could mix in more egg yolk! Also, I'd like to note that their Thai iced tea is not super sweet. Usually these drinks are like syrup and way too sweet, but this one was just right. 

A great neighborhood Thai place that isn't super Americanized.
author: Sara P.

description: Excellent thai food. I was debating an appetizer and the chicken satay was recommended: wow. It was really fantastic and the peanut sauce was excellent. I went with the fish entree. It was beautifully spicy with some great vegetables and a sort of paste holding everything together. Atmosphere was nice and intimate and the service was good.
author: Christin J.

description: If you're craving Tom Yum Soup, this is definitely the place to go! It's flavorful, spicy, and PACKED with delicious veggies. It's conveniently located near work for a pick-up during lunch, but I'll definitely be back to try more dishes and have a beer.
author: Laura B.

description: A nice little divey Thai place on Polk street in San Francisco. The waiter was very friendly and knowledgeable. I ordered the spicy chicken wings which were topped with peppercorn, ginger, garlic & lemon grass. Delicious. Also tried the tom yum soup which was a little below average. Maybe too much lime and not enough sweetness. Overall a nice place with some dishes you wont see at most Thai restaurants.
author: Matt s.

description:
The most authentic Thai restaurant I've been to since living in Thailand! If you want a real Thai food experience and not the Americanized Pad Thai BS that most of you think is authentic Thai food then go to Ben Thai. 

I am not getting paid for this, but I've honestly spent countless hours and wasted hard earned money trying to find a good Thai restaurant that would feed my need for nostalgia. I was so stoked to have called Ben Thai and find out they offered Khao Soi, a traditional northern Thai dish. During my stay in Chiang mai, I fell in love with this dish. I went to Ben Thai to try it and I have to say that while it was not an exact replication of what I ate in Chiang mai, it was pretty damn close. One of the biggest differences is that Ben Thai doesn't use a whole chicken drumstick when they serve up the dish as they do in Thailand. I am assuming this is all in an effort to cater to the American audience and not scare them away from the dish. I can definitely respect that. Gotta make a living in this expensive city somehow! 

I give this place a 5 out of 5. For all you peeps ordering the BS Pad Thai and "Pad See Ew", don't be so damn basic and get some culture between those chopsticks. Go out of your comfort zone and order the Khao Soi. You won't be disappointed!
author: Alys B.

description: We found this spot from Yelp and and we were not disappointed! The red curry was really delicious and I especially liked the ginger limeade drink. The servers were also very friendly and helped to create a fun environment. If you are looking for a relatively inexpensive dinner but still great quality then this is definitely a good option! I am adding it to my list of places in San Francisco!
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Solid spot for Thai food with good-sized portions and friendly service. 

I dropped in on a Friday night for dinner with a girlfriend. I arrived around 6:30pm and there was no wait and several tables open. I started with a Thai iced tea (you get 50% off if you check in on Yelp, woohoo! so it only ended up being $2). My friend and I shared the Murder Wings, (which I found to be moderately spicy, so don't be scared off!) and I ordered the Khao Soi as my entree while she got the House Fried Rice w/ duck and a side order of the steamed vegetables (not good, avoid). 

I found the Murder Wings not as mind-blowing as I'd have expected based off the glowing recommendations from several reviews, but my expectations were probably too high. Both our entrees were great, very flavorful and tasty but a little on the heavier side. We were going straight to a show afterwards and couldn't take any leftovers with us, so we tried our best to finish but couldn't quite accomplish it =P. Service was friendly and the restaurant is on the smaller side, so it's easy to catch the eye of your waiter/waitress if you need anything during the meal. 

I'd come back!
author: Vivian L.

description: Wonderful service and food. My husband liked the paradise wings and I enjoyed the vegetarian spring rolls. The best part of our meal was the Khao Soi! So much flavor in it and there was plenty for us to share.
author: Jasmine S.

description: Stumbled in here on a date after we had a few drinks and all I remember is repeating over and over again, "wow this is some damn good pad thai!"
author: Greta L.

description:
Pretty good Thai place, But Service is a weak spot.

Food 4.5
Service 2 
Interior 4

Service Problems:
Ask ppl what whey like to drink, not just iced water by default for everybody before even start a conversation.

2 persons ordered 2 soups. Second came 5 min after first. First cold. One of the plates cracked but they served anyway.

You need to ask for sauces by yourself.

After I paid, waitress asked me: do you need a change? Instead of give me one
Maybe she is need a money, but it's definitely not the way how she can earn it)

All of this downgrade tips up to $1/per person. Cheap eatery category.

Food:
Duck soup really impressive. Original fatty taste. Recommend it.

Tom Yam served in original way compare to other places.
Not spicy at all. You need to put it by yourself.
I prefer fried tofu instead of plain.
Regular pad Thai noodles doesn't taste so good compare to noodles in duck soup.
author: Sergey S.

description:
Great food and the best service ever!    Decent beer
Selection too (for a Thai restaurant).
author: Rayce D J.

description: I live really close to this place, so I have found myself coming pretty often, and every time I've left satisfied. I've probably ordered half the menu, but some of my favorites are the spicy eggplant and basil beef, roast duck noodle soup, and panang curry.
author: Cynthia M.

description: The Duck Curry, Koi soy soup and the ambience are on point at this little restaurant.
author: Rick O.

description: Great non-US Thai restaurant. My friends from Thailand always say if you see tomatoes in the rice or other dishes, it's not authentic. This place is really good & super close to my house. Tom Kha soup is great & their signature noodle dish is as well. The crispy pork skin etc nom! Just go!
author: K B.

description: Visiting San Fran and my stomach was on E. I asked the brother that checked us in at the hotel, "Where would YOU go eat right now?" This was one of two spots he said was fresh and excellent!  My brother
author: George C.

description:
Just stop for a quick to go pad Thai , very nice friendly server . 
Food was ready when got there . 
And now really enjoying. 
Thank you we be back soon .
author: Love F.

description:
I initially tried this place due to Yelp reviews. Reasonably priced Thai, authentic, and not part of a chain? Hell yeah, I'm going to try this place. 

Was not disappointed. Have been back several times since. Love their green curry (my go-to at thai restaurants), and love how great the service is. The green curry has the right amount of kick to it, and pairs great with rice. This last time, I had ordered green curry via Caviar since I was sick at home and asked for lots of eggplant. They gave me lots of eggplant! 

One other time, I went with a friend and we ordered a bunch of stuff ($100 for two people). Everything was soooo good. The oxtail, the fried prawns, the green curry (duh). 

Family-owned and operated and a little gem on the Polk street corridor. I love this place!
author: Evelyn C.

description:
This is our go-to Thai place in the Nob Hill / Pacific Heights area. Pad Kee Mao Noodle is a solid tried and true. Roasted Duck Curry is a little different but the true star of their menu!

Take-out is hella quick. My last order was quoted at 20 minutes and it was more like 10.
author: Colt S.

description:
Man, I'm kicking myself for not taking a picture right now. 

Last night, I ordered the green curry for delivery along with the pad see yew and a cucumber salad and boy, was I impressed. 

The Keow-wan (green curry) comes with your choice of protein cooked in coconut milk with eggplant, string bean, bell pepper, broccoli, and basil. I opted for chicken, which was a perfectly light accompaniment to the amazing broth. It was rich, flavorful and perfectly spiced. Easily the best Thai curry I've had in San Francisco. 

I've given up on noodles for delivery as they don't travel well and are stuck together by the time they get to your house. Regardless, the pad see yew was flavorful and the quality of chicken was solid. 

I'll be back for the curry fo sho.
author: Benjamin F.

description: Last Friday my friend and I decided to do an impromptu double date with our guys so I picked this joint as its been in my bookmarks for a long time. I'm the type of person who tends to stick with dishes i know and not stray away from them for the fear that I might hate it and now have to be stuck with a meal I don't like. My usual go to is pad see ew. No one really messes that up and it's a safe bet. However, on this rainy and chilly day I saw a duck noodle soup on their family's favorite (or whatever) menu and I was instantly tempted. I love duck but what if their duck is nasty or what if they give me 1 or 2 measly pieces? I bit the bullet and ordered the duck noodle soup and I can tell you that it is what I will be getting there from now on. Any thai restaurant can make pad see ew but I don't see duck noodle soup everywhere. The duck slices were massive and definitely did not skip on the meat. The broth was flavorful and soaked in all the juices and marinade from the roasted duck. I am so glad I lived on the wild side and got to try this amazing dish which I am sure to make a staple on my cold, chilly SF nights.
author: Yvonne L.

description: Solid Thai Food. It's not as good as Ler Ros, but it's in a slightly nicer location.
author: Noel J.

description: What's with all the wonderful reviews? This place is adequate normal average run of the mill ok Thai food. I could get the same thing in Altoona, Lubbock, or Saginaw. Nothing special. One needs monkey molars to chew the pork it was so tough. So go have lunch, plunk down $12 and get back to work.
author: Moe B.

description: Great food with friendly service! Try the Pad Thai with vegetables -- best I've had anywhere.
author: Justin G.

description: Nice quaint restaurant. Pretty clean and service was fast! I loved my Noodle dish! I can't remember the name that of it but here's a picture! I wish the Thai tea had boba pearls though.
author: Rose C.

description:
The food was okay and the space uninspiring. I ordered the Pad Thai with chicken and a Chang beer. The Pad Thai was acceptable, but a bit too greasy and sweet; it was also difficult to distinguish between flavors/textures. 

The space felt random and designed without a real sense of purpose, combining traditional Thai decorations (portrait of Thai royalty and artifacts) and modern abstract art (abstract painting of a dragon on the wall). There was a little bit of everything in there. The place didn't have a distinct feel to it; it's not quite right for a romantic date (too plain and out in the open) and it's too mellow/small for group dinners (quiet chatter scattered around the small space). 

Some other details: The portion size is large, the price seems right at about $12 for the dish, and good friendly service.
author: Behnam S.

description: Come here every time I can in San Francisco - best Thai food my goodness. I absolutely the love the vibe and the food
author: Chaz B.

description: My friend and I stopped here on our way through SanFran. We ordered the chow mein noodle with chicken and the chicken skewers with sticky rice. In both means the chicken was inedible. It was like biting into straight rubber ! Disgusting, I would not recommend. Needless to say we got out of there as soon as possible.  YUCK
author: Tina M.

description: Food was so flavorful, which can hardly be said about most Thai restaurants in SF. Never a long wait, super friendly staff. My faves are the papaya salad and chicken pad Thai.
author: Andrew W.

description:
We were in the area so decided to come here. 
We ordered the curry soup with egg noodles, (I forgot the actual name of dish) their specialty and we LOVED it! 
It was delicious!!! 
We also ordered the Oxtail soup. I love a really good oxtail soup from my trips to Thailand which unfortunate have not found  here in sf. 
So I was so excited to go to a restaurant that had oz tail soup. 
unfortunately, it was nothing special. 
It was expensive too @$16 for a small bowl. Would not recommend it. 
We weren't so hungry so ordered only 2 entrees but I would love to try their other dishes next time. 

Staff were courteous and helpful in choosing our meals. 

I would definitely come back here.
author: Jen O.

description:
TL;DR - Great quality Thai food that actually tastes pretty healthy too.

We usually order from here if we are staying in. The usual go-tos are khao soi and pad thai. But honestly, we've probably tried most of the menu and its pretty solid. 

Only mini-gripe is that the service isn't SUPER friendly... but I guess that doesn't matter when you order take-out.
author: Crystal Z.

description:
My favorite Thai restaurant in San Francisco!!

Came here on a Saturday evening and luckily we came early enough to beat the rush! My friend and I were staring at the menu for awhile and decided to order 4 dishes just for the 2 of us. No regrets!! We ordered the Pad See Ew with Beef, Pad Thai with Shrimp, Crab Pancake, & Murder Wings. Everything was PHENOMENAL!!

Crab Pancake - Amazing especially with the dipping sauce. I recommend ordering this to share as an appetizer. I've never had anything like it but will definitely be coming back for more.

Murder Wings - So flavorful and the lemongrass flavor adds a nice spicy kick! Also a great appetizer to share. 

Pad See Ew w/ Beef - I LOVED IT and one of the best I've had yet! The noodles had the perfect chewy texture and a nice hint of sweetness. YUM! And it also tasted just as good for leftovers 

Pad Thai w/ Shrimp - You can never go wrong with Pad Thai!! The shrimp in the dish were huge and cooked to perfection. I approve!

I definitely will be coming back whenever I'm in San Francisco. The staff here is so friendly and attentive. Our waitress was also a sweetheart and made sure our water cup was always full. That's what I call great customer service! Can't wait to come back and try more items on the menu!
author: MyTien P.

description: Came during lunch on a Monday and the service was fast and friendly! The atmosphere is cute, nothing special but it feels clean and you can tell they put care and thought into the place and food. I had the Murder Wings and Khao Soi. The murder Wings were tasty and very unique, but I can't say I would get them again. I would recommend trying them but if you aren't big on bold flavors and spices  then I would predict you wouldn't be a fan. However, I swear by the Khao Soi soup! It's one of those dishes that you know you'll distinctly crave now that you've had it. It's spicy, so if you can't handle spice possibly ask if they can make it less spicy. It had notes of lemongrass but not the usual bitterness that lemongrass can bring in Thai soups. The pork rinds might sound weird but they really made it a knock out dish. Do NOT leave this place without trying this soup. I'm a big noodle soup gal, and this was one of the best I've had!
author: Kathleen F.

description:
Last weekend, a couple of friends flew up to SF in celebration of a birthday. During the weekend and by request, the birthday friend wanted to eat at a great Thai joint. From my last experience, I knew Ben Thai would be the right choice. 

Running alongside the experience, I MUST talk about how wonderful their staff is. Earlier that day on Saturday, I went to pick up a cake from a local bakery to surprise my friend with. The problem was, he was staying with me so there was no way I could bring that cake home. I decided to call the restaurant and ask if they would hold it for me in their refrigerator. Unexpectedly, they answered their phones while they were closed and agreed to hold it! When it was time for the surprise, not only did they bring out the cake, they also accompanied it with a scoop of ice cream and candle. I was sooooo appreciative of that :) Overall, the staff was very consistent in service to that story. On point, everyone was so sweet and so efficient/accommodating to our party. 

The joint is cozy and offers two dining areas next door to each other. The two rooms don't seem to be cohesive, however you can tell they acquired two different spaces and combined it to offer more room for diners. As busy as they were, they did a good job in turning the tables for future guests. 

For dinner here's what I had: 
-Chicken Satay for $9: Chicken skewers marinated in herbs and spices, served with peanut sauce and cucumber salad. The dish came with about 5 skewers and filled with chicken I love the quintessential peanut sauce for any Thai dish, let alone this one. 

-Paradise wings for $9: Sweet and savory fried chicken wings sautéed with a touch of garlic and topped with fried basil. This was a complete winner for me! Super flavorful and crispy, like the menu says, it's "The saint to our murder wings' sinner." TOTALLY true!

-BBQ Pork for $12: Thin slices of lightly grilled pork marinated in a blend of thai herbs and spices. Served with side salad and a savory sauce. OMG, this was my favorite dish hands down! So much pork in this dish! It was never ending. I tried to order brown rice for $2 on the side to be healthy and it was a little gummy; should've ordered the white rice but the dish more than made up for that! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

-Oxtail Soup for $15: Oxtail slow stewed with carrot, tomato, and cabbage. This dish is rich and hearty, with a great balance between sweet and salty. Ok so I got this the last time I was here but I couldn't pass up the opportunity to talk about it. I LOVE the amount of oxtail that's in this dish the broth is rich and flavorful. Order a side of rice for $2 and you've got the PERFECT soup on a rainy day (or any day for that matter).

I'm so happy this place is so close to my apartment. I'll be coming back here time and time again. Thank you guys, for an amazing experience.
author: Rockne H.

description: I totally recommend this spot! Was out and about with some friends at the wine bar across the street and they brought our dinner over to us.  Go for their fried apps and noodle dishes.  The bomb haha.  Nice to see some SF locals doin' it up right.  Keep up the hard work.
author: scott P.

description:
Really great service.  Ben Thai Café was a perfect choice for a cold rainy night with friends.  They provide your more standard fare of Thai dishes and some more unique ones as well.  The bill came to $200 including tip for 6 people.

"Great" dishes:  Khao Soi (AMAZING), Chicken Satay (x2), Tom Yum (1 chicken, 1 shrimp), Pad Thai w/ shrimp, Fried Banana & Ice Cream (x2)
"Just Ok" dishes:  Murder Wings, Papaya Salad, Green Curry w/ beef, Pad See Ew w/ chicken
author: Patricia N.

description: I've had good to good+ examples of some of my favorite Thai dishes on a couple occasions at this restaurant. Recently, on a busy day, I had some of the most bland Green Curry and Pad Thai I've ever tasted. I ended up not eating about $25 dollars worth of food.  I can't recommend this restaurant on a busy day/hour when the cooks don't have time to make things right.
author: Douglas P.

description:
Flavor: 4/5
Value: 3/5 ($80 for 3, no alcohol)

My dish: crispy duck curry. Different from other curries. Flavorful, however, aided by a lot of salt (marinade?). Others ordered more traditional dishes, which were solid; but I'd gladly order the duck dish again.

As an aside, the hot Thai tea (unsweetened, unlimited refills) was good
author: Wolf C.

description: Our favorite Thai in the city. Great curry and noodle options. High quality ingredients and fast service.
author: Matt D.

description: Cozy little retreat.  Pad Thai was delish as well as the duck noodle soup with a side of steamed veggies.  Will visit again soon!
author: Ana G.

description: Wanted good Thai food and stumbled upon this place on yelp. Very quiet relaxed atmosphere great food. Will definitely come here again on my next visit to San Francisco
author: Janine S.

description:
We were walking down Polk towards Modern Thai and found Ben Thai was new and decided to try it.  
The Murder Wings were spicy and delicious.  It was a cold last night so I ordered the Tom Kha with chicken it too was spicy and flavorful. 
The Spicy Eggplant & Basil with Beef was so good!  
We also had the Larb Salad with minced roasted skin-on fatty duck.  
All excellent choices.  Fresh ingredients cooked to perfection and served beautifully.  
I recommend this place to anyone who really likes Thai food.  It's not your regular run of the mill Pad Thai and Curry kind of place.  Check it out!
author: Antonio D.

description: All the Thai foods so good here I can say. This is a small Thai restaurant but everything is so good I mean about foods drinks and service.
author: Somphop S.

description:
Giving the food here a 5-star rating. Sure, the service was a bit inattentive, the restaurant cramped, and the ambiance perhaps leaves something to be desired, but we Yelpers know the quality of the food comes first and I must give credit where it's due! 

We got the cucumber salad, Pad Kee Mao tofu, Panang curry tofu and brown rice. Everything was fresh and delicious. Portions were very generous as well. 

Walking out of the restaurant I also saw several interesting dishes I wanted to try next time. I'll be back, Ben Thai!
author: Hillary D.

description:
Ended up in San Fran for an errand. I was hungry as hell! 
I decided to google the closet Thai place and Ben Thai came up!
I have to say.. this is one of the best Thai restaurant that I've been to. Very friendly service. No wait time. Especially... the food was fantastic!
Pad thai was good, very flavorful. Same with the yellow curry.
Next time I come back to SF I will try other dishes!
author: Fanice K.

description: Went there with my Family for lunch. Had the Tom yum soup and Gra prau(chicken). The base soup of the Tom yum soup was amazing. The Gra Prau was a perfect lunch I was looking for. I have had Thai food in higher end restaurants in NY and LA, but the food here was absolutely great! Very reasonable price and great Thai food. Highly recommend this place.
author: Kengo W.

description: The service is friendly and ambiance is nice. The lower rating is due to the food quality. While the som tam was good, their chicken larb and pad see ew were not great. The texture and flavor of the larb was off. On the pad see ew, noodle flavor and texture were ok but the meat was tough and flavorless and the broccoli not cooked. I think there's potential here but ended up with 2/3 poor dishes.
author: Derek K.

description:
It's not a bad option if you're on Polk Street and feel like Thai. I think it's a little better than Thai Spice, which is another Thai restaurant nearby.  Not sure if there's a lot more options right in walking distance but if there are, I'll definitely try others before coming back. Not that Ben Thai was bad but it seemed expensive for what you get.

The Pad Thai is $12, as are their lunch specials which come with rice, a nice portion of food (got the eggplant and chicken) and a plain "salad" (more like a mound of lettuce).  So lunch for two, with gratuity is $30.  Which I know, in SF seems to be normal, but walking out of there, it sure didn't feel like a $30 meal.  At least I got one more meal out of it as leftovers but for $30, I think I'd rather go somewhere else, or even get delivery from House of Thai 2 and get more variety!

It's nice inside with two sides of the restaurant - when you face the restaurant the right side is for pickup and delivery people and the left side is if you are going to dine-in.  There was one server for all 8 tables (yes it was fairly crowded when we went in, mostly 1 and 2 people on tables) and she was very friendly and seemed to manage all of the tables well.

Food: Pad Thai was kind of one note. Not too sweet and not that yucky pink color at least.  But it could have used a little more depth and crunch.  The eggplant and chicken was really tasty, just a little oily.  Portions were generous, and in fact there was so much chicken in the pad thai that the next day for leftovers I felt like I was eating chicken with a side of noodles.

Oh they also seem to serve unique things (like mealworms, and crickets) but that's not my thing so I can't comment on it other than to say it's on their specials menu sometimes...

It's a casual Thai spot that I can't complain about, but I also can't really rave about either.  I think I'll try other places just to get a feel but I could see myself coming back here when I am craving Thai food in a pinch.
author: Traci H.

description:
We shared the Pad See Ew and the Peanut Chicken dish. Both were perfectly made and flavorful. Sometimes Pad See Ew can be gummy, but these noodles were anything but. The sauce was soooo good. The peanut chicken was very flavorful. I liked mixing the two on my plate. We opted not to order a side of ride for the peanut chicken and didn't miss it.

It was very warm inside the restaurant. I'm glad there was a bit of a wait to allow us to acclimate. Otherwise, I wouldn't have been able to enjoy my food.
author: Annie W.

description: Thai people work here. That's about as good as it gets. The proteins were all horribly overlooked and the flavors are disappointing. The environment isn't bad for the price in sf, but if I was looking for Thai food or any cuisine that was done reasonably well, I'd go somewhere else.
author: Brian B.

description: They serve up the best Khao Soi we've had outside of Thailand. Highly recommend that dish and the pork neck with sticky rice.
author: Alex B.

description:
Our household are once-a-week regular here.

Things we love:

Friendly, family owned small business.

Penang or green curry with chicken: good flavor, a go-to for our house.
Crab pancake (eat-in only): crispy with a hint of crab and this delicious red sauce. (A little funky, maybe has some fermentation to it.) 
Pad see ew: the BEST. Awesome slippery noodles with tons of flavor.
Duck Noodle Soup: I get wide noodles. This dish is a little fatty due to the duck, but it has TONS of flavor, is a huge portion and always hits the spot when I'm in the mood for soup.
author: Natasha W.

description: We order the duck curry often from here. It is the best red curry with duck. However, so far we only love that dish-duck curry. We have tried many other dishes but we did not like them very much. So we just like to order the duck curry Togo.
author: Kent Q.

description: My girlfriend and I came here one afternoon for lunch and it was very good. We were the only ones there at the time and it was very nice. We got the golden bags to start off, then the Pad Thai, Pik-king, and BBQ chicken as our main course. We were very hungry people lol. I was very excited about the Pik-king but there was this strong taste to it that I don't know how to describe honestly. It kind of turned me off to it. However, the golden bags were fun to eat and very tasty. BBQ chicken was A+ and the Pad Thai. Dear lord. Make sure you get that.
author: Isaac H.

description:
As a Thai food enthusiast, this is one of the best restaurants I have ever been to. First off, I must start off by HIGHLY recommending you guys order the Paradise Wings! They're the perfect level of crispy and also sweet and tangy but not too overwhelming. The Murder Wings are also good but I personally preferred the former. I ordered the red duck curry and I was captivated by the creamy richness from the coconut milk combined with the plump and flavorful duck. I was pleasantly surprised by the occasional sweet pineapple which I thought added something special to the dish. The owner Tarin is such a nice guy! He brought out the fried banana with coconut ice cream for me and my friends to try. Although we were full, this desert is insanely awesome and had us questioning whether it would be a good idea to order another one.

My mouth is watering just by writing this review! I'm definitely going to revisit Ben Thai very, very soon!
author: Karl G.

description:
I'm not sure why this place has such great reviews, for one the cleanliness score is only 73 in this place, ick.  The service was below average, there was only waiter trying to take care of everyone. 

The food:
Green papaya salad: nothing special, had this at every other thai place
Chicken satay: again nothing special, large portion, chicken was pretty dry 
Duck curry: Usually I don't get duck, the portion was nice, the flavor was good, the duck was fatty and skin on as they said, so we had to cut that off, but it was tender 

I can't say anything in this place was special or surprising or of high quality.
author: Inga W.

description: Was really craving Thai food today, so my family stopped by here to see how it'd be. It was honestly amazing! The food was great, especially the Pad Thai and Gra Pao. I haven't tried anything else, but I'm sure it tastes just as good. The service was also amazing, as everyone was so nice and helpful. Loved it here, and I'd definitely recommend anyone to stop by! It's a great Thai restaurant with an Indonesian and Chinese twist, which was so cool to see, being Indo-Chinese myself!
author: Claudia K.

description:
Utensils would've been nice. Good thing I'm not above shoving my face into sweatboxes to get at those tender slivers of whitemeat. #thatswhathesaid And darkmeat. #heyyooooo #blackinnuendosmatter

Dishes weren't earth-shattering but weren't bad. Solved my hangrymergency. Delivery driver arrived at the exact minute I'd chosen via app = cool.

(^_^) Oxtail Soup $14
Needs more than 2 meat pieces plz.

(^_^) Lek's Pork Palo $12
Umami yomami.

(^_^) Honey Lemongrass Lemonade $4
Lemongrass not overpowering.

(-_^) Murder Wings $9
Reviews hyped it up; ::shrug:: deece.

My bag #ironically contained a straw, which was the only type of dining device I didn't need since I drank from the cup. #like10000spoonswhenallyouneedisaknife I was left to #trough, use fingers, or postpone the foods - didn't feel like eating stew with only my hands.
author: Dan B.

description: The service was great, food was delicious, and would definitely dine here again! I ordered the murder wings and they were crispy, spicy, and overall tasty!
author: Camille C.

description: The best Thai food I've had in the past year. Amazing tom ka gai. The atmosphere is nothing special, but the food is outstanding. Decent beer selection for a Thai restaurant as well. Highly recommended.
author: Michael S.

description: First time to San Fran and looking for a Thai place to enjoy dinner. Not disappointed at all especially after reading everyone's reviews! Customer service was great their bbq pork was probably the best I've ever had wish I remembered the names of the other stuff I ordered lol but those noodles and fried rice were amazing too ! Reasonably priced under 50 bucks for my meal in picture Highly recommended
author: Edward S.

description:
I ate alone over there so I had the time to look around me and look at the other dishes from other customers. Mine was absolutely fantastic and the others looked beautiful and yummy. I recommend the, i'm going to copy and paste: 
Khao Soi (Northern Thai)
Egg noodles swimming in red and yellow coconut milk curry with your choice of chicken, pork, beef, or tofu, topped with crispy pork iskin, cilantro, green and red onion, fried shallots, pickled mustard greens, and a mound of fried egg noodles. This is our mother's version of this delicious dish from the north of Thailand, made special for her son-in-law.

Go there!
author: Guillaume L.

description:
This place is only 6 weeks old but you wouldn't be able to tell by the steady influx of patrons here for dinner. Yelp told me that this was a place to visit, so I obeyed and brought friends.

I ordered the pad kee mao and my friends being white naturally gravitated towards the pad thai and pad see ew. I judge all Thai restaurants based on how they make their pad kee mao. This place does it right with quality cuts of beef, good level of spice (although they didn't ask me for level of spice like most other Thai restaurants, but they offered their spice tray) and well cooked noodles and veggies. All the dishes were $12.

My friend got the pad see ew topped with duck meat and I must say it was delish! I must get it next time. It added $3 to the price but I think it was well worth it for what you get.

The service here was quick and attentive with plenty of wait staff. They also had a check-in deal with free homemade lemonade. I thought it'd just be plain lemonade but it was mixed with ginger and made for quite a refreshing drink to our dishes.

Overall, good food, legit Thai flavors, and convenient location in the Tender-Nob area. And if you're in a rush you can order through the Yelp app to go or for delivery!
author: Sam L.

description: The Duck Curry was awesome and the yellow curry had lots of flavor. Service was on point for takeout and I would definitely go back when in the area.
author: Matthew B.

description: We came here because of the great reviews and sadly we were very disappointed. The service was extremely slow and they never brought out our main dish (curry duck). We had the pad thai, and egg plant but no duck. When we asked the waiter for our duck, he left and came back with a lame explanation "duck is roasting, duck takes a long time" instead of saying ooops I forgot. The food was okay, I've had better Thai elsewhere. If you go, stay on top of your order. Enjoy!
author: Loren A.

description:
Walked in on a friday evening. Was seated immediately. The first thing that came to my mouth was the almanac ginger gose. Very light and refreshing beer. 


The atmosphere is pretty romantic. Almost candlelit dinner and i made good conversation with the people i was with and super super kind and warming management. The item on the menu that caught my eye was the lek's pork palo. I was addicted to the egg and the broth and i heard that the recipe was from mom herself!! 

It was delicious and the eggs are SOOOO good, that was the one thing i kept on going back for. I wish i could pack the sauce with me to go home. The murder wings were sooo good i would def 'kill' for them again. Hahahah. The capers and herbs were perfect! And it wasnt too drenched in sauce. It had a kick of spicy but not too overwhelming. I def will come back for the pork and eggs! :)
author: Linde H.

description: Close to the hotel, staff was very nice and the pork is a must!   The cozy atmosphere adds to the romantic evening.
author: Melissa H.

description:
We were looking for a good Thai restaurant in San Francisco so we looked at Yelp for help. There is a good reason why Ben Thai is on top of its list .
This little hole in the wall is a gem! If you are looking for authentic tasting Thai food this is the place for you. The Kaisao and the oxtail soup are stand outs for me and my group but everything was delicious. If you come and enjoy end this delicious meal with the mango sticky rice! Wow it is so different than any other place we have tried out. 
Hope you find the time to enjoy!
author: Agustin F.

description:
So Yelpers I'm not sure who's reviewing and if people just hand out stars now but get it together.

Not even greeted 15 minutes waiting. Open tables were available. With all the restaurants in the area there needs to be some level of standards. 

Total FAIL
author: Joseph E.

description: Amazing food excellent portions. Good unswetead Thai Team. Totally recommend the Pad Ram chicken and Las Thai. Well located and very traditional
author: Aracelis N.

description:
My family and I came here for dinner because we wanted to try their mealworms. We got there at the end of happy hour and got a dollar off all the appetizers. Checking in also gets you 50% off one non alcoholic drink. 
For drinks, we got Thai iced teas and the honey ginger lemonade.
For appetizers, we got two plates of wings(murder wings and paradise wings) and the prawn rolls. The wings were very flavorful and came with a decent amount and the shrimp was perfectly fried and came with a nice dipping sauce. 
For entrees, we got the papaya salad (tom sum), the fried fish, the pad Thai, the Ouse fried rice and a dish I can't remember cause it wasn't memorable. The papaya salad was kind of bland and could have been spicier. The pad Thai was quite average but tasted good. The fish wasn't very good and definitely not worth the price. The fried rice was my least favorite dish. It had a weird taste and wasn't like the Thai fried rices I've had before. 
The mealworms came at the end of our meal. They were good, well seasoned and resembled popcorn. After popping a few in my mouth the thought of eating worms didn't really gross me out anymore because it really didn't feel like I was eating worms. Instead it felt like I was snacking on popcorn or chips. 

I gave this place 4 stars even though their food isn't that good because I really enjoyed their appetizers, their service was fast, the servers were nice and they were able to make worms actually taste good.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
My friend and I tried the oxtail soup and the khao soi.
The oxtail soup is very savory, the meat itself is very tender and soft, the vegetable add freahness to the dish. For the Khao soi the broth is very creamy and not too thick so that it's overwhelming. The chicken meat absorbs the broth well, making it more savory and flavorfull.
author: Elitè T.

description:
Went on a Sunday around 8 p.m. There was a short wait for parties of three, but multiple two-tops available.

Ordered the Murder Wings which I found very good, but overrated -- the crispy basil accoutrement was the best part of that dish.

The roast duck noodle soup, however, was out of this world. The skin-on duck was packed with flavor, and there was plenty of it. By the end, I was completely stuffed -- and I came hungry.
author: Anthony D.

description: The food was great but they took a bit longer than quoted in the takeout time and they forgot the rice which was unfortunately a bit part of the curry orders. I'd give them a shot in person again as the food was delicious.
author: Chelsie A.

description:
Just simply amazing.  I give it 4.5 stars, great everything. It would earn five, but I've had a few other Thai experiences that top it, so in fairness to the other five star restaurants.....

The menu is relatively short, a strength, as they focus on what they do best. I ordered Gra Prau fried rice. Nearly perfect. If visiting San Francisco, worth a stop for reasonably priced Thai. Nice people. Attentive.
author: Anthony B.

description: As a visitor to the area, this Thai restaurant is pretty authentic. Ordered pad thai (shrimp)which was very flavorful, the papaya salad was a bit sour on the lemon drizzle but it was still good. Fried pork with sticky rice was delicious too* although keep in mind that it contains different herbs and lemongrass so the taste is strong but unique for some people. Friendly staffs and awesome service! There will likely be some waiting time but it's totally worth it.
author: Cat Van M.

description:
Had a catered lunch from here for work so I got to taste a little bit of everything!

For what I was able to try:
- Vegetable Spring Rolls: Not a complete standout but overall quite tasty, would recommend.
- Ka-ree (yellow curry): The rice itself was a tiny bit undercooked in my opinion but the curry itself had a distinctive flavor.
- Pad-Thai: definitely one of the better pad thai places. It had more of the lemon/lime sour taste which I actually really liked.
- Pad See-Ew: A little bit on the bland side, a little bit more sauce or something would have made it better.

We had some leftovers and many people were eager to pack lunchboxes to take some home. I'll probably come back sometime for another helping of the pad thai.
author: Cassie Z.

description:
Experience: I saw some good reviews of this place and wanted to give this place a try. We walked from Jackson street (knowing that we'd probably be consuming a good amount of carbs) to the restaurant. The place is small and it was busy on a Sat night. We finally got seated after 30 minutes.

Food: It was a little bit of a hot mess in terms of floor management. But i'll get to that in the next section. I ordered the Salmon and red curry and it was sooooooo good. The fish was cooked perfectly and the veggies were great. But that curry was really really good. I wanted to drink it! I also ordered the homemade Thai tea which reminded me of the thai tea from the vendors in Thailand. My party ordered the oxtail soup which was super soft and the broth was flavorful. We also ordered the Pad Thai which was good as well.

Service: i wish the service was as good as the food. They were super slow to order our food, and the food came out so late. We waited almost 30 minutes after noticing the people who got seated around us, who ordered the same thing, got their food first. The waiter just said "it's coming." Boo.

Final thoughts: Food was great, service meh. Not a place I'd walk 6 blocks to go to again.
author: Winnie P.

description:
SF just gained another super solid Thai restaurant! After seeing pics of the Khao Soi from a friend I had to come try. Between our party of four, we ordered two Khao Sois, Pad See Ew, and the Green Curry. Everything was very tasty and a good portion. We ended up with leftovers.

My favorite was definitely the Khao Soi, the curry was on point and I swear each bite just gets better and better. It was pretty addicting. :P

Service was super friendly and attentive. Definitely worth revisiting soon!
author: Sophia H.

description:
Big shoutout to the chef/owner Tarin! Great person, great service, great restaurant.

Ben Thai is the epitome of a family owned small business. Located right off Polk street, it's a perfect location. The restaurant is small, but great things come in small packages. The restaurant was full when we got there, and a line started to build up, so be prepared for a light wait, but it'll be for sure worth it.

I ordered the pad see ew with chicken, could never go wrong. It tasted delicious. Most pad see ew's I've had were either too sweet or too saucy, this one was a great blend of both. The portion was perfect. Also, I had the papaya salad, it was amazing. There was definitely some kick to it, as any papaya salad should. It taste super fresh. Usually, I wouldn't want more after I finish at other Thai restaurants, but here, I wanted more..

You're definitely in store for some great food and great service. Compliments to the chef!
author: Hev Z.

description:
Came here while visiting SF. There was a line to get in, but for good reason.

Once seated, we got a super handsome waiter *swoon* who was pretty attentive. I ordered the pad kee mao and my friend ordered the pad see ew. The pad kee mao was AMAZING. Finished every bit of it. We also had some of the sticky rice and mango which looked scrumptious but didn't get to try it myself.

I'll definitely be back when im in SF again.
author: Jessica G.

description: Great food, very friendly service, even when I came in at 3:10, when they close at 3:30 for lunch! Was not rushed at all, in fact, I was encouraged to take my time and enjoy the food- I will most definitely be back
author: Christopher B.

description: I had the lunch portion of the panang curry.  It was just okay.  Watery, fairly bland.  Maybe I should have gone for the pad Thai since that has so many good recommendations, but the curry left me unimpressed.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Great Thai food and usually no wait which is a plus! Have been here a handful of times and have never been disappointed. Love their Khao Soi (Northern Thai curry noodle soup) and roasted duck noodle soup. Have tried their appetizers (wings, crab pancakes, and pork of the heavens), yellow curry with sticky rice and pad thai- all solid dishes as well. Lots of beers on tap, but would not recommend getting wine here!
author: Peggy L.

description: Great food, friendly service. I liked the relaxed ambience of this restaurant making it family friendly and comfy for anyone. Prices are decent and the Indonesian flair makes this Thai restaurant unique. It's a hidden gem in my neighborhood and I'll be back for sure.
author: Linda N.

description:
Came in for our first time.  The place is in an area where you're gonna have to find a parking garage cause you can't find a spot on the street and if by chance you do, you'll get into an accident trying to parallel park.

This is not a small restaurant, but for the life of me I can't figure out why they had the back room closed.
We had a relatively early reservation so there was no wait, but by the time we were ready to leave on a WEDNESDAY night I could barely push through the people to get to the restroom in the side room.

The food and service were both good.  Trying to find a mild dish might take some guessing.
I had the BBQ lemongrass chicken and my husband had the pad thai.
Both get very good ratings.

I am a fan.
author: E A.

description: Food was very delicious and fresh! I enjoyed the pad see ew and look forward to returning!
author: Darnell B.

description: Love this place and the service is 5 stars! Its a bit small but it can fit group of families. The food us soooooooooo delicious! Except for the murder chicken. Not that good the green curry tom yam n som tam were soo good! The price is reasonable too! Try the ginger tea! So refreshing!
author: Inda I.

description: Very good quality Thai, great lunch prices. I had the basil chicken and a Thai iced tea. It was very tasty and I would go back again.
author: Regina M.

description:
I was already full by the time I came by. This was also the third place that we tried to eat dinner at, because the first place was closed, and the second place had a really long wait, so we didn't really care about where we were eating at this point.

I split the duck curry with a friend, pretty good. I didn't get a chance to try any of the other food but it didn't look like any spectacular. I have my go to Thai spot in Santa Clara.
author: Kenny N.

description:
We loved this spot! 
I ordered a delicious Karee  Curry dish with shrimp and a side of brown rice. It was delicious. Very clean and tasty! 
I highly recommend this Thai restaurant if you are in town!
author: Sarah L.

description: Not recommended for take out.   I ordered 3 dishes at 5:30 on a Tuesday night from Ploy.  She said 10 minutes.   1 dish took 5 minutes, another 10 minutes and the 3rd one 32 minutes.   I sat there waited patiently for 25 minutes.   There was no sorry, there was no rushing.   I explained that I was bringing the food to one of their customers who had an injury and lived nearby.  I suggested that they apologize and perhaps offer beverages or appetizers to people waiting that long.   Only then, Ploy said "sorry".  5 minutes later, we start eating and some food is cold, some is hot, but none was that good.
author: Brad L.

description:
This restaurant was recommended by our hotel. The food here is fabulous!!! 

We started off sharing fried prawn rolls. They were very good.  Not oily at all.  The sauce we used to dip the rolls in added to the taste of otherwise scrumptious rolls. 

For my entree I had the Ka-ree with calamari.  It was great. Of course Thai food uses some terrific spices to flavor the food, so it was to be expected. 

We topped off our meal with fried bananas. They were awesome.  

Bottom line is you need to give this place a visit if you want some Thai food.
author: Cee S.

description: Excellent food and service, would highly recommend and very well priced, plus lovely decor while you dine :)
author: Elyse W.

description: Food is amazing. Pick off their favorites menu, the dish from northern Thailand is awesome
author: Fran C.

description: One of the best Thai foods I've had. Very impressed with their food quality and great service.
author: Nalini S.

description: I get this place every week for takeout. Always great! Favorite spot! Order on yelp very fast and easy always ready on time. I like the pad tai spicy
author: Mike C.

description: My family and I went to Ben Thai for lunch. We had the pad see eu, curry chicken and BBQ chicken. The food was delicious. We also ordered a Thai ice tea to go. It was a short walk from our hotel. I would recommend!
author: Christina F.

description:
STOMACH ACHE ALERT-
Ordered red curry and chicken satay....
I think the satay chicken was old and previously frozen... Was like rubber and today I have a horrible stomach ache from eating their food.....  Make sure it's fresh
author: Chris T.

description:
With the amazing reviews this place has, I was expecting refined food that stood out from other Thai places & nice friendly service. That is not what I found.

We came in for a late lunch around 1:30 on a Saturday. The restaurant was empty, besides from one table that was taken. Our waitress barely said hi to us and didn't smile at all, which wasn't very welcoming.

I liked that there was a lunch menu even on weekends. $11 for a dish is a great deal. I ordered the Peanut Pra-ram with Prawns served with brown or white rice and a salad. I substituted the rice for an extra salad. $3 were added for the prawns.

The service was very quick. 4 Prawns only were served with my dish. Lots of peanut sauce which was lukewarm, not hot like you'd expect it to be coming out of the kitchen. It tasted pretty good but kinda industrial, like it came out of a can. The (few) veggies were crunchy and good. The salad served on the side was just mixed greens with a tiny bit of an average dressing. There were little pieces of dark salad like lettuce gone bad. I put them to the side and kept on eating the rest of the dish. I'd expect to get the freshest salad in a restaurant.

My +1 had a green curry which he found OK.

I liked the location of the place & the price but I would not return. It was nothing special to us. 
I like the atmosphere & quality of food much better at Lers Ros.
author: Leslie S.

description: Such a cute restaurant! I was craving Thai food and I'm not really familiar with the area, so I'm so glad we stumbled upon Ben Thai Cafe. The service was great, everyone that worked here was so sweet! The straw paper was shaped like a rose and the rice was shaped like a heart, such cute attention to detail. :) I also loved the atmosphere and decor.
author: Courtney K.

description: Took quite a while to get sat. Happy we waited though because the food was really good. Ordered the chicken sautéed skewers & they had this delicious peanut butter drizzle to put on top of them, could have eaten so many of those.
author: Shanelle H.

description: The food here is amazing and authentic, and the servers are so welcoming and kind! The pad thai, northern Thai noodles, and panang curry are delicious!!
author: Cayla K.

description: This is a good place. Ordered the duck curry as so many reviews had recommended, and it was tasty. Great coconut red curry flavor and the vegetables mixed well. My only complaint was the duck. The menu does say it's fatty... but I underestimated the fattiness. There was almost no meat, just skin and fat. I would order a different protein next time, but if you're into duck skin, then you won't be disappointed.
author: Britney B.

description:
Fast, clean, tasty. 
Came for lunch, left very satisfied. 
Tried the meal worms as an appetizer, they were surprisingly tasty. 
Had red curry with chicken off the lunch menu. 
Would come back without hesitation.
author: Hans F.

description:
