Yelp has a real grade inflation problem. This place is, honestly, "a-ok" like the Yelp guidelines for a 3 star restaurant specify. It is not a nearly perfect restaurant like the 4.5 star rating suggests. 

The fried stuff is very good. We liked it.  The noodle and soup dishes are competently executed imitations of good Thai food. Perhaps they're dumbed-down for white people (we really missed the fish sauce) or maybe something else was holding it back. But these are not the droids you're looking for.
author: Aidan G.

description: This place is absolutely amazing!! We happened to stumble on this place while visiting and we were so happy we did. The inside gives the perfect ambiance for enjoying home-cooked Thai cuisine with a little Chinese flare. I've eaten all over Bsngkok, Pattaya, and the countryside and this is the BEST Thai food I've come across - even beats Sophias in Davis! Eat here, you will not regret!
author: Ryan M.

description:
If you haven't tried Ben Thai, you're missing out. Delicious Thai food, nice decor, fantastic service, and all within an intimate setting.  We had the chicken satay, chicken larb, beef larb, prawn rolls, duck fried rice, tom kha soup, pad kee mao - it was all outstanding and tasty!  My favorite dishes were the wings, duck fried rice, and BBQ pork with stick rice.  My friends and I had to try EVERYTHING!  Flavors came through in all dishes and portions are generous; they don't skimp out on the shrimp or duck. 

Service was amazing and the owners are friendly. I really appreciate that they serve ginger lemonade (non-alcoholic) and have a variety of brews too. If you want unpretentious Thai food, strongly recommend hitting up this spot.
author: Dee H.

description: Simply superb. Everything we ate was delicious, our server was super polite and nice, some of the best Thai food I've had in this city.
author: Alicia T.

description:
Great portion sizes, tasty, and excellent service.

Mango sticky rice--highly recommend. It wasn't on the menu when I went, but upon asking, the waiter assured me that it's a regular menu item. 

Pad Thai--pretty good, on par with other Pad Thais in the city.

Ginger Lemonade--we got this free with a Yelp check in. No joke, that drink is ginger central (I coughed after taking my first sip, it was that strong). My boyfriend liked it though and continued sipping it throughout dinner.

**We went on a weekday night. There was no wait!
author: Yanni L.

description:
Been trying a lot of Thai places in the area. Enjoyed this one as it is a little more like a restaurant than others in the area. It's small and cosy, and no bright canteen lights.
The service stood out too. Very friendly Staff. I had the Panang curry with chicken and prawn. It was pretty good- curry sauce was the best thing. 
Will be back for more- it was relaxing here.
author: Derek M.

description:
Cute place and really delicious food.

We ordered murder wings, spicy tilapia, spicy eggplant and basil, and BBQ pork. They're all spicy and very flavorful.

The waiter was really friendly and refilled our water promptly.

Will come back!
author: Novalina N.

description: If you like lots of sugar and salt (perhaps MSG) in your food, you will love this place.
author: ann b.

description:
I arrived on the early side for lunch.  Approaching the restaurant I saw a lady cleaning the front windows.  Score!  Dirty windows and doors are a restaurant pet peeve of mine.  Can't bother to keep the front looking decent, I can't imagine what the kitchen looks like.  

Seems Ben Thai has taken over the former location of Chi-yo.  I found the red chicken curry to be excellent, EXCELLENT!  Full of fresh vegetables, green pea pods, zucchini, and other veggies. There was a choice of brown or Jasmine rice.  I had the Jasmine rice and it was very flavorful and well cooked.

Service was efficient and the restaurant is nicely decorated.  Can't wait to return.  Now open a Ben Thai in South Florida, would ya?
author: Jeanne T.

description: Authentic Thai food, amazing Thai Iced tea!! An absolute must try! We had the Thai pad with chicken and a Sauter beef curry. It's the first option on the lunch specials! OMG it was deliciousness!! Must have Thai!!
author: Melisagloria D.

description: Service is bad. Waited a good 35 mins to be served appetizers. They didn't even apologize for that. Food was decent but maybe it was because we were starving!
author: Will T.

description: Came hugely recommended but honestly waiter was extremely pushy and rushing us to order and it wast busy. We work in the restaurant industry so are always fair but seriously I hope they read this! Chill out smile a little more and don't be too pushy.
author: Zinah A.

description:
There were so few review but I'm glad we took a risk and tried Ben Thai. My family was famished from our long drive back from Yosemite and ordered almost every single appetizer: Murder Wings ($9), and Chicken Satay ($9), Pork of the Heavens ($9), and Prawn Rolls ($9). I actually loved the Chicken Satay the most, it made me want to come back for more every day. 

Famished, we also ordered two soups: Tom Yum ($9) and Tom Kha ($9). They came FAST (maybe 5 minutes) and were such beautiful soups, really! Ben thai is also really generous with the soup portion, which came with plenty of mushroom, broccoli, carrots, all cooked in a coconut milk based soup. I think just one soup is probably enough for 4 people.

My favorite entree was the Khao Siu ($14), which was egg noodles with pork and veggies in a broth, topped with crunchy pork rind and crunchy noodles. It is definitely a unique homecooked dish that you don't usually find in other Thai places, and I'm so glad I got to try it at Ben Thai.
author: Shelley C.

description: Pricey in my opinion for how much they gave for takeout! .. Doesn't come with rice either so don't forget to order that. For just Curry i paid 23 lol including tip
author: YH L.

description:
I'll be back!!!

I've been to a few Thai restaurants in the area and one thing that sets this little place apart is the variations of the different culinary regions of Thailand as well has the touch of some family dishes based on momma' sown cooking. You'll also notice the Indonesian influence on several of the menu items.

The service was attentive and quick Thai hospitality. My beer mug was full all the time. Didn't have to ask for a thing. My server was on point. 

Definitely try the Khao Soi. A traditional northern Thailand staple. And don't be afraid to explore the different Thai pepper sauces to bring more heat to you dish
author: hans simon f.

description: All the food was fresh with great flavor! Friendly service and no wait. This was our first meal in San Francisco, we came here for lunch and were not disappointed! Try the northern dish, it's served like a noodle soup or a stew and was delicious!
author: Kendra J.

description: Decent Thai food for a good price! When eating thai food in the city, I'm ready to dish out $14 but most of the dishes here are $10. The servers are really nice, attentive and it's open pretty late.
author: Amanda K.

description: Cute little place and great service! Staff was so nice and the yellow curry was delicious. Definitely recommend and I'll be back!
author: Sarah K.

description: I had never heard of this place before but when a friend recommended it, I was perfectly happy trying a new Thai spot. We started off with a bottle of Pinot Noir and decided to order some apps. We ordered vegetarian spring rolls and corn fritters. The spring rolls were good but the corn fritters were so unique and SO DELICIOUS. I could've eaten dozens of them. For my entree, i ordered the Pad Thai with chicken (my go-to). The servings are massive! Easily 2 meals in one. Plus, it was really good pad thai. I was pleasantly surprised with this restaurant and would definitely come back!
author: Ilana B.

description: Everything was outstanding! So much flavor and care in their dishes. Best pad Thai I've ever had
author: Mitra K.

description: Great spot! I visited from out of town based upon the great reviews and it definitely lived up to the reputation. Great food (the flavors were all right on and generous portions), good service, at a reasonable price! Would highly recommend!
author: Joseph P.

description: Thai. Polk Street. Go here. Great food no questions asked. If you're a curry monger like myself, you'll enjoy their delicious versions. But everything else is great too (and who doesn't like their rice shaped like a heart-awwww). Every person I bring there loves it. Don't be left out :)
author: Janice C.

description:
This was an unfortunate first experience. Grabbing pick up, and arrive at the confirmed time. Only two entrees, one was ready when we got there, duck larb. The other, pad thai, was not ready yet, but were told it would be out shortly. 20 minutes later, the larb continuing to sit there, and the pad thai comes out. Pad thai was hot, larb absolutely cold. 

Not sure I'll try this place again, but hoping that those who eat in have a better experience.
author: Joe H.

description: Peanut chicken was delicious, the rice came out in a love heart shape and the wrapper was made in to a little rose on top of the strawer. The little touches and great customer service made it a great lunch
author: Gemma F.

description: This is the second time that we've tried Ben Thai Cafe and it is going to be our "go to" Thai restaurant now! I wish they delivered, but easy pick up tonight. I parked a half a block away and there were a lot of parking spots, even though it's Saturday night! Delicious food and good potion sizes.
author: Janice S.

description: Delish!!! Spicy just right. Flavorful! Great prices. We'll definitely be coming back!
author: Raley S.

description: Ordered take out from here last night. Got the Pad Kee Mao, Yellow Curry and Murder Wings. The flavor of everything was on point, but I found the Pad Kee Mao to be waayyy too greasy which is why I'm giving this place 3 stars. Curry was nice. Just the right creamy balance of sweet, savory and spicy. We got the Murder Wings since it seemed popular, but found it too dry. Would come here again, but would skip the Pad Kee Mao.
author: Shannon L.

description: Ordered delivery from here - we ordered the Pad Thai, Pad Kee Mao extra spicy and chicken satay and larb with sticky rice and penang curry. Overall pretty good however very little meat in the curry compared to another nearby restaurant Tamarind Hall. The portions do look bigger in the pictures than what we got for delivery. Overall delicious! Thank you.
author: William L.

description:
I must say I fell in love with this place immediately as we walked inside. The decor is a mix of traditional (Wooden awnings) vs. modern (Old Thai Horror Movie Posters) . Very clean and comfortable (BIG +). I thoroughly enjoyed the food I found on their menu. 

I was able to find foods that I've only seen on the streets of Bangkok. It was definitely love at first bite.

Highlights of our meal --

-- Corn Fritters - Fried corn deliciousness paired with a fresh cucumber salad. I hunted for these on the streets of Bangkok daily and they have them here!!!
-- Golden Bags - New take on a Samosa and oh so appealing on the eyes
-- Pad Kee Mao with Shrimp -- (My absolute favorite Thai dish) - This dish had a ton of veggies with fresh fat/flat noodles. 
-- Fresh Coconut - Not the real coconut canned kind but actual fresh coconut!!! 
-- Craft Beer - I would come here alone just for this (currently Deschutes and Kolsch)


I hear that these are must trys for the next time - 

-- Spicy Catfish
-- Monster Wings
-- KJ Noodle Soup
-- Papaya Salad
-- Crab Pancake
-- Pork Palo 

I can't wait to come back and try all the other dishes on the menu (BTW - best menu ever - simple and to the point.)
author: Amber D.

description: Eat here if you like fish paste. A LOT of it. On everything. Unfortunately, I don't. Kind of a bummer, because I got the impression that the food was probably pretty tasty if you could have tasted something besides fish paste. It was fresh and well presented. The service was excellent, too
author: Ryan S.

description: I loved the marketing for this place and my duck red curry was also really good. It was easy to get in on a Thursday night.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Serving sizes are huge, as many thai places are. I forget what I ordered (oops) but a bunch of us ordered different things, and all the dishes were super flavorful and delicious! 
Their ginger soda drink though was 70% ginger and 30% other. So unless you REALLY love ginger, i'd say keep away from that one.

The service is a tad bit slow because they dont have many workers to take care of you, and the space is a bit cramped. But the location is great!
author: Grace P.

description:
Good food, great presentation, cool atmosphere, gracious hosts!
The "Murder Wings" are truly unique!
author: Joseph T.

description: The food was super fresh - from the side salad to the rice. I got the spicy eggplant lunch special, which was really good. However, it wasn't spicy at all to me. I think it's super cute how they molded the heart-shaped rice...details! The mango sticky rice had wonderful presentation and I was easily able to share it with three other people.
author: Kirby L.

description:
Really flavorful Thai food -- different than most Thai restaurants. It was very busy last night, so the service was a little disorganized -- but it's a Cafe, and the staff were friendly, if overwhelmed. I've ordered both take out and dined in. Delicious, not too expensive and definitely worth a try. 
I've had the Pad Thai, the curry, the shrimp appetizer (the best!) and have been pleased all around.
author: Yasi S.

description: I was in search for a really good Thai place in the area and this was it! We went around 8pm on a Friday night so the place was pretty busy. Pretty much every seat in the place was filled. Atmosphere was nice either decent service. We got the tom yum soup and the golden bags as appetizers. Both of which were delicious! The golden bags had a lot of flavor and I would definitely get them again! As my entree I got the spicy eggplant with chicken. It had really great flavor but not a lot of spice. Definitely would recommend this place!
author: Angela Y.

description: This spot has delicious food and the staff is extremely friendly. Vegetarian friendly with full of flavor food. Good sized portions and a clean place. I claim to be somewhat of a Thai food connoisseur and I was delighted to enjoy dinner here. If I was from around here, I would definitely be coming back.
author: Olivia D.

description:
TLDR; Great and healthy food. High quality ingredients. Value for money!

Ben Thai is a very homely neighborhood Thai restaurant in SF. My husband and I love Thai food and we have been exploring different restaurants all around the bay area. Ben Thai is one of our favorite places. 

Being Vegetarian there are plenty of options - their Papaya salad, Pad Thai and Gra-pao fried rice are my favorite.

Really good value for money, and their ingredients are very fresh.

Highly recommend this place when you aren't in the mood to cook, during the middle of the week, but want to eat healthy.
author: A S.

description: 'Good portion sizes and not too oily or greasy. And their green curry game is on point' -Megan
author: Sam G.

description: Get the Khoa Soi. You're life will be better for it. It's a delicious curry with so many different flavors and textures with each bite.
author: Joy J.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here on a Saturday night and found parking right away. The interior design and atmosphere was clean and comfortable. Service and food was great! Our server made sure our glass of water was always filled.

We started off with the golden bags and also ordered tom kha soup as well as a pad kee mao. All the ingredients were super fresh and delicious. The meat was not over cooked or dry like most restaurants that I've been to. While the golden bags were really tasty with the sauce that they provided, I do wonder how it would taste if there was some kind of curry sauce dip to it. That would make it even more golden! 

Overall, I would definitely come here again!
author: Denise J.

description: This is the best Thai food I've ever had. I ordered their Khao soi, BBQ pork, duck larb, and chicken curry. This place not only tastes authentic but it's delicious. The customer service is good, waiting to be seated can take kinda long but it's worth the wait. The ginger lemonade was too spicy and gingery for my taste but other than that I'm down for those Thai chilis on the side. If you want amazing, gratifying authentic Thai food, skip The "Michelin star" Kin Khao and come here.
author: Jessica L.

description: mediocre lunch. I've had much better. Spring rolls were good. Pad Thai was flavorless. Satay was ok. Stingy with the peanut sauce. Won't be back.
author: Harvey L.

description: Thai is my favorite food so I hold out top scores only for what I think are the best Thai restaurants. I found Ben Thai Cafe on Yelp and the reviews looked really good, so I decided to eat here with my kids. Thank goodness we did; the food was amazing! I had Gang-dang (red curry) with tofu. Other than not having cashews (which I love in curries) the food was amazing. We also had the vegetarian spring rolls which came with a great and unique sweet ketchup sauce. My daughter had Pad Thai which she loved and my son their House Fried Rice which also was good. Loved the food and the vibe of the place (great Latin music was playing when we went). And the service was amazing!!
author: Jon Y.

description: Delicious food and great service! I had the hot wings and chicken satay...best peanut sauce, ever. Hot wings were about a mild to medium spice.
author: Cobbler S.

description: Unfortunately I didn't even get the opportunity to eat here. I was completely ignored by staff for over 5 minutes. Not a "hello", a "welcome", an "I'll be right with you" There wasn't even a wait. As I sat waiting for some type of greeting the food looked mediocre (& I've had done AhMazing thai food) so we went else where. If you like quality customer service & great ambiance don't bother going to Ben Thai.
author: Chrys L.

description: My family and I had a wonderful meal with good service here. The wait staff was very friendly. We had Tom Ka soup, BBQ Pork, Pad Thai, and the Yellow Curry. All the food was very good and was delivered to the table promptly.  We left right at closing and the waiter spent a few extra moments with us. My wife expressed interest in making the sauce that came with the BBQ Pork at home and the waiter gave her the recipe when he brought the bill. We rarely repeat restaurants while on vacation but this little gem might entice us to go back before we head home.
author: Martin D.

description: Food was awesome but the service could be better.   It's a small Thai place in SF but because of the yummy food, it deserves 5 stars.  I ordered the Green curry, fried rice with fried chicken, beef basil and eggplants and wings.   Absolutely delicious!  The service was a bit slow but it was worth it because I had complaints about the food. Next time you're  in SF, check this place out.  About 1 mile from the Fisherman's WHARF.
author: Steve L.

description:
Have had almost every item on the menu.  Favorites are the green curry, sauteed eggplant, crab pancakes, and the Thai coffee.

Small, cozy atmosphere and extremely friendly staff.

They have been getting busier and busier so the wait is getting a bit longer every time I come, but it's always worth it and they do take-out!


Thai food restaurants are usually a pretty "standard" experience.  Nothing great, nothing terrible, but Ben Thai stands out and really makes it taste like home cooking.  This is definitely the best Thai I've had in SF.
author: Cody C.

description:
I noticed that this place is on Amazon Prime Now. I also had no idea that Prime Now had freakin' restaurants, so that's pretty crazy. Anyway, this was the first restaurant I saw listed, so I thought, eh, why not?

I was recently introduced to red curry, so that's what I went with. For $13, I was skeptical...until I saw the ratio of stuff:soup. Usually, curries are a ratio of around 30:70 (stuff:soup). This was closer to 60:40 (stuff:soup) which was surprising. Lots of tofu and veggies! So many bamboo shoots, which is really what it's about! Woot! Also, spicy. But I'm also a weakling when it comes to spicy, so don't mind me.

I also ordered sticky rice. I think I ate too much. I forget that sticky rice is RIIIICEEE and really more than the normal amount of rice a person should really eat. I sort of ate the whole thing. I was also very hungry. They were also able to deliver ginger lemonade! It was delicious, but admittedly a bad idea when I already thought the curry was spicy. Didn't soothe me as much as I thought it would.

I'd definitely order from here again, and I'd like to stop by their physical location as well!
author: Robbin A.

description: Great food! Excellent service. The portion size is abundant so everyone gets to try each other's plate.
author: Tanya N.

description: Really really good thai food! We had the special curry soup with noodles and it was amazing! The duck curry was also good, but a bit spicy- though I still loved it. The service was amazing even though we came almost at the closing time, but we were not rushed and served with a smile! Definitely coming back!
author: Aya J.

description: Came in here on a Sunday night around 7:30; this was the perfect time, as we managed to get a table for 6 with no wait at all. They do not take reservations, so this worked out well. The menu was divided into different categories from curries and sauteed items to specials like the Khao Soi (which we got and was awesome). Dishes are best enjoyed family style. Four of us split 3 dishes and this worked out well. In addition to the Khao Soi, we also got the Gra-prao and Spicy Tilapia & the Chicken Satay as a starter. The service was good and the food was even better. Would recommend for anyone looking to get their Thai fix without having to waste 2-3 hours waiting for a table!
author: Sheena P.

description: Delicious! Great classic thai dishes like pad tai and dunken noodles. Also some good unique dishes like crab pancake. Drink selection is good and their ginger mimosas are delicious!
author: Daria V.

description: Chose this restaurant based on the great review but was really let down. Quick delivery via Caviar but food was very bland, especially the pad sew eu. Wouldn't order from here again.
author: Samantha G.

description: Really good food, amazing service. Not the flavors I was expecting, but still a phenomenal thai experience.
author: Doug M.

description: So amazing! We are visiting the city from out of town and read the reviews and came to check the place out. Food was awesome and service was beyond perfection. If you are in SF and wanting Thai food go to this place!
author: Jessica P.

description: We really enjoyed the pad kee mao, it had a hint of basil in each bite. Pad Thai and papaya salad were great too. The flavor of Paradise wings were on point but feels like we got really small wings. The tiniest bite. Good atmosphere would come again!
author: Melissa L.

description: I had to come on just to write a review for the Khao Soi (it's on their family favorites menu). So good!! It was so flavorful. We ordered several other things too such as the golden bags and murder wings. We weren't crazy about the wings, but everything else made up for it. Super friendly service too. We were there on the earlier side (around 6pm) and a line was starting to form as we arrived because it is a small space. Highly recommend!
author: McKenzie M.

description:
Get the pad thai! You will not regret.

The flavours were so rich I can still remember the taste a week later.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
Such a great addition to the neighborhood. The food is amazing but more importantly the staff is super friendly and kind. We brought our fussy 10 month old in when they opened (an attempt to try not ruin anyone's meal) and they were so sweet and accommodating. They brought him some sliced orange to chew on and offered up ice cream.

The food is fresh and super flavorful. Not at all greasy so you don't leave feeling like you need to be rolled home. I had the Panang Curry and have had the Pad See Ew and both were delicious. Definitely making this a regular spot.
author: Kelli D.

description: I love the Bangkok style papaya salad  with salted egg and peanut sauce Pah ram. The fried banana with coconut ice cream is truly yummy!
author: Lilibeth D.

description:
We've been wanting to come here for a while...

And we finally made it (and we're glad we did!)

Service: The servers were on point throughout the evening. They were welcoming and friendly. We were properly seated, and the food came out in no time. The chef even came out and highlighted some recommendations on the menu.  

Food: 
We ordered the following: Murder wings, Gra-Prao and House fried rice, Thai iced tea. 
The Murder Wings were deep fried to perfection smothered in a lemongrass homemade sauce. I'd say the Gra-Prao is similar to a Basil Chicken type of dish you'd get at a Thai resto. It was pretty tasty and I loved the bamboo shoots. The clear winner of the night was the house fried rice (we added chicken). I can't exactly pinpoint what sauce they use, but it was delicious. 

And the Thai iced tea, you can't go wrong with this drink here. It actually tastes like a Thai iced tea is supposed to taste- the right amount of sugar, tea and half & half. 


Overall, we really enjoyed our dining experience at Ben's Thai Cafe. 

We came, we saw, we ate and we will be back.
author: Nance H.

description: Great take out Thai food. Delicious fresh papaya salad and really good crab fried rice.
author: Tracey K.

description: It's amazing to find a hidden foodie treasure inadvertently. The crispy fish I had was divine (my girlfriends words). Too bad I don't live in the city or I would have been a regular at this place.   I too enjoyed the food ordering off menu Crispy duck with steamed vegetables and peanut sauce--nicely done!
author: Eric W.

description: Great small shop Thai restaurant off of VanNess. Many different flavorful specials that seem to be staples of their reg menu. Well worth the Muni trip to get there.
author: Dave S.

description: favorite thai in SF! the ka-ree curry is amazing as well as the pad see ew and fried rice. highly recommended!
author: Andrea C.

description:
I came around 9PM on a Sunday night so of course there was plenty of open seating. I ordered an unsweetened ice tea,  the green curry and my friends ordered the Khao Soi. 

Unsweetened thai iced tea - I am just so grateful this is even an option. Kudos to Ben Thai for providing this because I've never seen it offered anywhere else.  It's about $1 cheaper than regular thai iced tea and it's less sweet because it does not contain the condensed milk. Most times I order thai iced tea, it comes way too sweet but this was perfect! If you like condensed milk, you may be disappointed because this is just tea and water with a hint of sweetness.  They also design the straw wrapper to look like a rose which I thought was cute!

Green Curry - I ordered this with tofu and brown rice. The brown rice came served in the shape of a heart. The green curry tasted good, but like any other green curry. Nothing to write home about but then again, nothing to complain about either.

Khao Soi - The best way to describe this dish is that it tastes like red curry with noodles in it. It comes served in a bowl that looks exactly like a ramen bowl (even the reddish broth + noodles) makes it look like ramen. I love red curry so I thought this dish was delicious. At $14, the bowl of soup is HUGE. The broth is curry so it's very rich and I think it would be hard for me to finish the entire thing by myself. However, it did contain these sliced pickles which my friend did not like. For the record you can order it without the pickles if you also do not like them. I've never had pickles in my thai food so it may taste weird to some. I highly recommend this dish if you're feeling adventurous and want the most bang for your buck.
author: Amanda S.

description: Loved loved and loved this place. Each plate we orders was great. The service wasn't great but the food was amazing. I give it a four star only because the service wasnt there.
author: Leila H.

description: Great service, small place so good level of intimacy, and there food was really authentic & delicious.
author: Daniela D.

description:
Ben Thai has some very good Thai food on Polk Street! I had never heard of this place but was Yelping a Thai restaurant somewhere in SF on a Saturday afternoon and stumbled across Ben Thai. 

We arrived around 2pm with a group of 5 and were seating immediately! I tried the red curry with tofu, pad kee mao, and the basil tofu dish. All 3 were great! The red curry was thick and creamy and had a lot of fresh veggies. The pad kee mao had great flavors and it was not too spicy. The basil tofu dish was probably my least favorite out of the 3, but it wasn't bad! The flavors were a little milder, but still and overall good dish!

One thing that I really liked was that they have lunch specials even on the weekends! This is some good Thai food in SF, which is surprisingly very hard to find. I will definitely be back again!
author: Malika R.

description: Chose Ben Thai from all the great reviews while visiting the area. Was not disappointed, food was phenomenal & service was great. Would highly recommend to any Thai food connoisseur!
author: Jennifer B.

description: Tom Kha soup with prawns was outstanding. Wonderful combination of lemongrass, coconut and other spices with large fresh prawns. Very large serving. Husband had Khao Soi which was fried egg noodles with red and green curry with the meat of your choice with Thai spices. Perfect amount of spicy, sweet. Delicious light sauce. Service was friendly and attentive. Best Thai I've had to date.
author: Sophia K.

description:
TOTAL WASTE OF TIME 

Walked in to an empty restaurant. Minutes pass. An older couple (table #2) walks in, gets their drinks. A group of three ladies walk in and get seated (table #3), gets their drinks. Table #2 get their order taken. We flag down the waitress and place our order for drink, appetizers and main course. A couple walks in (table #4), they order drinks. A group of 3 people walks in a gets their order taken (table #5). Time goes by. Table #2 gets their food. We wait. Table #3 gets their food. We wait. Another couple walks in (table #6) and has their order taken. We finally get our appetizers. Table #4 get their food. Tables #4 & #5 get their food. We wait. Table #2 PAYS and LEAVES. We are still waiting. The waitress is even eating behind the counter. We wait. We flag her down and ask if our food is coming because by this point people who arrived 25 minutes AFTER us are eating. Waitress says "it's coming". We wait. We finally give up and go to pay for the appetizers. The waitress says our food is late "because we ordered appetizers"--as if we were to blame.
author: Janetta R.

description:
Oh. My. Gosh. Best Thai food I've ever had! This place will now set the standard for any other Thai food I eat. Unfortunately for me, I was just a tourist when I ate here so I won't be getting it again for a long time. 

The place is clean & quaint with modern touches. It feels new (not sure if they just opened). Small place but I didn't fee cramped inside. Saturday night I went in and was seated immediately. I shared the prawn rolls, pad Thai with prawns, and chicken Thai fried rice. Everything was perfect as far as taste goes. I split the food with one person and we were completely stuffed and still had enough food on the table to take leftovers to make another meal for 2. The bf asked for sweet & sour sauce for the fried rice, but ended up not using it because the rice actually had a slightly sweet flavor. I can't emphasize how great the food was, especially the huge portion sizes. Service was good, nothing spectacular. Took a while to find the waitress when we wanted to pay. If you are in SF and searching for Thai food this is your place!
author: Tiffany C.

description: Wow!!! I ordered the savory Khao Soi and I could not be more happy! It literally made me smile from ear to ear! It's a good portion too! This place is now my go-to Thai restaurant on Polk St.
author: Jezzica B.

description: Love Ben Thai!! This is my go to Thai place in SF. I always get the curry with the sticky rice and it has yet to disappoint.
author: Leslie S.

description: Excellent service, even better food, and classy but casual environment! Enjoyed a meal here with a group of friends that quickly became family style: we couldn't decide whose dish was the best! It's a relatively small space, so may not be an option for large groups, but the five of us were seated quickly and the service was excellent. The wait staff was friendly and attentive and the food came out quickly. I'm a sicker for Pad Thai (which was excellent) but the Khao Soi was definitely the crowd favorite. Will definitely be returning to try the Jasmine Rice Saison and explore the menu some more!
author: James R.

description: Nice small homey place. Good portions nice people and great music and ambiance. Love coming here!
author: Brendon N.

description:
Sub par food, bad service. 
We stat down and ordered Tom Kha, soup, and it came out within 10 min. The waiter insisted that he serve the soup to us in our individual bowls, even though we were insisting that  we were capable enough to pour soup into our own bowls. We waited for our entrees for over 20 min. The spicy eggplant was overly salted , like it had been soaked in soy sauce. The chicken pad tai had flavor but I found an eggshell in the dish , and the waiter argued that it is common to find eggshells when cooking with eggs. Thanks for not charging me for the entrees , still needed up paying 14$ just for the soup.
author: Fayth Y.

description:
Review for take out only.  Great new Thai place on Polk St.  In the Nob Hill/Tenderloin area, there are a lot of Thai take-out options with varying reviews, but Ben Thai will be my new go-to when I'm craving this cuisine.

Pad thai with tofu was great!  The take-out portion is huge and can easily serve as two meals.  It was not greasy at all and had lots of tofu & veggies.  My dining companion got Pad Kee Mao noodle w/ chicken, said it was very good.
author: Sona P.

description:
Good place, decent menu, good price. Too much light near my table, but alright.
You like Thai? I've had a Panang Curry that was very good. Recommended.
author: Andre P.

description:
A newly opened Thai cafe right nearby, we popped in for a quick dinner before a movie down at the AMC Van Ness. 

The inside is a bit fancy and it wasn't busy when we came in. We were seated quickly and the servers took our order after we'd gone through the menu. There were a fair number of vegetarian options for me to choose from, but I went with a standard Pad Thai dish to get an idea of the quality. My partner went with the pork Gra-prao.

Our food came out quickly and I was very impressed with the look of our food. We dug in quickly and I was floored by how delicious my pad Thai was, easily one of the best I'd ever had. It was flavourful and tasty, the right amount of sauce and not greasy at all. A good assortment of vegetables rounded out the noodles and tofu.

Overall, the food was worth the price tag, the service was fast and pleasant, and we had a great dinner experience. There's a few items on the menu that grabbed my interest and I'd love to try on a return visit. Due to the convenient location, we will likely be back.
author: Cassandra J.

description: We love Ben Thai! Murder and Paradise Wings are incredible, it's a must-try. Excellent service, such nice people. Love coming once a month!
author: Holland M.

description: This place is almost as good as Lers Ros.  Service great both times I've been there.  Love the Pad see ew, Duck Larb.  Curry was pretty good too.
author: Jay H.

description: 4.5 enjoyed this small mom and pop spot.  the murder wings with nice flavor tamarind spicy style but not the double fried skin type to keep the meat juicy, so a little too dry despite the complex wet sauce.  the khao soi noodle was nice, good coconut, did make me thirsty after.  the spicy fish fillet pretty good with the sticky rice.  interesting to see fried mealworms on the board.
author: Rob C.

description:
I have been here two times and I was disappointed both times. I am not going back. 

Usually if the food is good I don't care much about service. The first time I went there I had a fried rice which was so so. Today I had the green curry with rice and it too was just okay. 

Service is mediocre.
author: Bhanu V.

description: Flavorful dishes, great portions, no complaints. There were plenty of options for vegetarians and carnivores alike.
author: Leiana R.

description:
Attentive staff and delicious food. It doesn't get better than that. We were greeted and seated the second we walked in. Thank goodness the food came quickly too because I was so hungry! 

We had the murder wings and they were phenomenal. Flavors were bold and wings were cooked just right. My boyfriend ordered the duck curry. It was rich in flavor and the perfect consistency, not watered down and runny like some other restaurants I've been to. I ordered the ox tail soup and, I must say, it stole the show. It was perfect for a cold day. The soup was well rounded and the meat was tender. I couldn't ask for more. Literally. The portions were generous and if I had more, I would have to take it home to-go. 

I had an excellent experience at Ben Thai, and I am already planning my next visit.
author: Abby L.

description: best thai in SF, hands down.  they don't skimp on spice and the menu always has originality.
author: Mike T.

description:
Decent thai food and nothing to write home about. We got the pad thai, red curry chicken and chicken satay. All were decent but didn't make me wanna go back here for sure.

Bottom line - check it out but with no expectations. I might go back if someone else ends up picking it as a dinner option.
author: Kabir S.

description: Very clean delivery and delicious and fresh tasting ingredients! Good size portions too. FYI it's not at all spicy...but still great flavor!!  Definitely recommend :)!
author: Maki J.

description: Best Penang curry I have ever had! I added potatoes. They had purple sweet potatoes. Amazing!
author: Sherry A.

description: Best Pad Thai ever  and delicious Thai iced tea. Very fast service and hot and yummy food
author: Amanda D.

description:
Just ordered from Ben Thai for the first time. Saw that it was new to the hood with great reviews.

Red curry with prawns had very few veggies (only zukes and peppers) and exactly five tasty prawns. More like a soup. 

Chicken basil was overly salty, not flavorful and not a whole lot of chicken.

Sad to not have a fresh spring roll or pineapple fried rice option.
Fried spring rolls were nothing to shout about. The sauce that they come with is like a nice bbq sauce. 

Overall it was disappointing and overpriced.
author: Angela M.

description: Stopped in here for lunch while at a business seminar. The place is super cute and the waiters were so friendly and accommodating. I love Thai food and I am very picky and the food was amazing. I had the yellow curry and it was delicious! My girlfriends ordered two other dishes and raved about how good it was. They scooped our rice into the shape of a heart and they folded our straw coverings into roses. It was nice that they take the time to perfect little details like that. I highly recommend this place. If I'm ever in the area again I will definitely be back!
author: Jocelyn S.

description:
Now this is my go to Thai.
I am a creature of habbit, and the garlic rice with garlic chicken is the best meal of my week. 
I order a little spice on the side and add it as I go. 
Order by phone and it will be waiting for you when you arrive. 

-your welcome-
author: Timothy A.

description: Our favorite Thai place in the city! The tilapia curry, pad see ew, the soup and fried chicken fried rice are highly recommended. Great for take out, but they also have a trendy and clean interior for dine in.
author: Katherine W.

description: Good service. I love their food. We order chicken curry,Pad thai, Tom Kha, and everything was good
author: Ili N.

description:
LOVE this place!  A friend and I had dinner here a few days ago.   Well, sort of.  We didn't make it to the entrees.  The appetizer menu looked so amazing, we shared several, and decided we were too full to keep going.  

Everything was fresh and flavorful.   The Golden Bags were a bit of heaven.  But I think I fell in love with the Monster Wings - perfectly done, packed with fresh herbs and just the right amount of spice.  

Extra points for having craft beer on tap!
author: Anna W.

description: Pretty intimate, definitely somewhere to go for a date night, but I wasn't blown away by the food.
author: Jack W.

description: Went there three times so far. Happy Hour is always great! Staff there are so friendly! Place is a very tiny but just right place to hang out. Delicious food! I went there to pick up some late night food for later and while the wait, staff were so very kind, informing how long to wait and gave me a glass of water(it was during the heatwave and nice touch!). I have been recommending this place to my coworkers when they ask me where to go in Russian Hill area.
author: Tomoe S.

description: For all the raving amazing reviews, I expected better, so did my two friends.  The best part was the appetizer, the golden pillows of potato curry.  I'll take those any day.  Service was quick.  Some of the food, like the heavenly pork appetizer, was really a disappointment.  It seemed like overcooked strips of pork (really dry).  Don't fall for the heavenly part.  It will cost you.
author: Vanessa W.

description: This place has the best pad Thai! We also tried a basil stir fry type dish, which was also very good, but the pad Thai was definitely the best. I'm a huge Thai food fan and this is now going to be my spot to get Thai food when I come into the city.
author: Ryann M.

description: Les Ros is usually our go to Thai place but we wanted to support the neighborhood & give the new place a chance .... And boy ... We were surprised at how good it really is! Should b a 4.25 star but 4 is pretty great! We loved everything ! The 'golden bags' similar to the samosa is delightful ! The exterior wrap reminds me of won ton skins ... I like it much better than the typical thicker samosa skin. The murder chicken has a great little kick & very flavorful. Duck noodle soup - soup is delicious & I don't taste any MSG.  Perfect for someone who likes just a bowl of noodles! Pad kee Mao - perfect stir fried w/the wok fragrance ...green curry - ummmmm so yummy ... Just enough of a kick with and very flavorful ... This place is definite a keeper!
author: Jay S.

description:
I got the thai iced coffee and really liked it. It was strong but not too bitter or too sweet. 

Got the golden bags and they reminded me of a light and crispy samosa - yum!

The murder wings were piping hot and crispy and really bold in flavor. I really appreciated the fresh ingredients used. It was an interesting combo of flavors.

For entrees, I split green curry with chicken and pad kee mao with beef. The green curry was really good, rich in flavor and not too spicy. I had it next day for lunch and it tasted just as good. The pad kee mao noodles were slightly wetter than I'm used too but still great with some heat, which I liked.

The restaurant itself is separated into two parts with a smaller lounge side and the main area where most of the seating is. I thought the decor was a good mix of modern and traditional. For a small casual place it has great decor.

For dessert, we got coconut ice cream with fried bananas and I gotta say, I think they make the best fried bananas I've ever had! They were crispy and in bite sized balls. So hot! but so good!

Service was excellent! Cinco estrellas. I'll be back!
author: Peter T.

description: The best Thai food in San Fran.  Curry is amazing!  Closet thing to Thailand we have found!
author: Charles G.

description: Fantastic Thai food for the price. I really enjoyed it even more than House of Thai. Very clean and modern inside. Loved the green curry and the BBQ chicken. Will definitely be back.
author: Yasi N.

description: Hands down one of the best in San Francisco. You will not be disappointed. We ordered the papaya salad, fried pork from Heaven, murder wings, pad Thai, pad see ew, chicken grao prao, ox tail soup, steak salad, pad ta lay, and more that I do not recall. Yum yum!!!
author: Yyer C.

description: Not too pricey but still a nice place. Food is solid and the service is great! Have been here several times and they always serve with a smile. Great place to take someone to - the only thing is they don't take reservations ahead of time.
author: SJ S.

description: Had Khao Soi w/ Chicken for lunch ($15) and a Honey Ginger Limeade ($4). I've had Thai food all around the USA (foodie who loves thai food) and this was one of the best. Curry broth had incredible flavor and the presentation was beautiful. Ingredients super fresh, plate came out hot. Very clean but small place. Chang delivered exceptional service. A new neighborhood go-to for us!
author: Alejandro R.

description: I'm not usually a fan of spicy food so I was hesitant to get a spicy dish but I'm so glad I did because the Duck Curry was absolutely AMAZING! 10/10 would recommend
author: Allison T.

description: Very small quarters, definitely more of an intimate setting and pretty warm inside temperature wise. Server was great, food was excellent and prices were very reasonable. Ordered Murder Wings but hardly any kick to them. Thought with that name they would be pretty hot. Just FYI.
author: Brian M.

description: Really good Thai food.  Thank you Yelp!  We walked right in and were quickly seated for lunch on a Monday.  I had the Panang Curry with pumpkin and it was delicious.  Others enjoyed the Pad Thai and the Pad See Ew.  The Corn Fritter appetizer was really good too.  We'll definitely add it to our rotation when we come back to beautiful San Francisco.
author: M M.

description: I'm new to Thai food but I love this place. I ordered through Yelp and it was ready very quickly! The shrimp egg rolls were my favorite, the pad Thai was delicious, and the chicken skewers were amazing. This will definitely be my go to Thai place.
author: Taylor P.

description: Best green curry in SF and trust me I've tried them all. They are getting really busy on the weekends for delivery though (Amazon + Caviar) so make sure you order with at least an hour in advance.
author: Megan G.

description: Food was delicious!! I can't wait to go back. Dishes were very flavorful. I had the Panang Curry it was delicious. I also had the murdee wings they were flavorful but not my cup of tea. I did appreciate all the special cars coming together that was quite impressive.
author: Rita S.

description: After reading all of the great reviews, I expected big things from Ben Thai Cafe.... And it exceeded my expectations!! At home in Melbourne, Australia, my husband and I have a favourite Thai restaurant that we were adamant was the best Thai outside of Thailand, but I honestly think Ben Thai may be better. Highly recommend the larb salad, the pad see ew and the fried rice with chicken! Food was delicious, drinks were good and service was lovely!
author: Dominique M.

description: I went here with a friend on a sunday night.  He had the red curry with roast duck.  I had the pad thai.  We both had thai iced teas and shared the murder wings.  Great service and the food was outstanding.  There was also a 50% off non-alcoholic drinks with a yelp check-in.
author: Sean S.

description:
I have a new favorite Thai restaurant in SF! We stopped here for a weekend lunch. We ordered the murder wings, Khao Soi with beef, and Pra Ram with tofu.

The sauces were all outstanding. The Khao Soi noodles were delicious with a great variety of ingredients. The wings were a bit overcooked but the flavor was amazing. The Pra Ram was served with a nice array of flavorful veggies and a fantastic peanut sauce with a generous amount of peanuts. 

The waitress was very friendly and attentive. The decor of the place is also very cute. We highly recommend checking out this place!
author: Alisha K.

description:
THE BEST Thai soup Ive personally ever had. It was called KJ Noodle with the 2 types of pork. 
Ill be back! YUM
author: Aline P.

description: The staff here are amazing. The ambiance is charming. I've only tried one dish twice here and I wouldn't give it 4-stars, more like 3.5 (slightly above average) but all the rest pushes me into 4-stars. Worth a visit.
author: Christopher M.

description: We ordered peanut chicken curry and eggplant tofu. The peanut chicken had too much peanut sauce. The service was staff was insufficient. The eggplant was excellent.
author: Ashish B.

description: This place is delicious. Considering SF prices it is very reasonable - about $13 per person. The ambiance is nice, however, the food is amazing. I'm a huge Pad Thai person and this place does not disappoint. The pad see ewe and panang curry were great as well. Murder wings new and different, and satisfying. Service was superb. My fiancé and I had a great meal and we will definitely be back again.
author: Morgan S.

description:
Great little restaurant - Great food, the wings were incredible.

Friendly staff and good food and prices, exactly what you want from a local eatery, will definitely be back!
author: Andrew D.

description: Really great food. We went there to try something new and this place was so good. The seating area was really cute too. We had the Pad Kee Mao and we highly suggest it. It had a heathy amount of spice that we always love but the veggies & noodles were so delicious. Service was great & out food was out in record time.
author: Courtney H.

description: Ive been to this place several times years before but it has been remodeled and is more comfortable after they got rid of the carpeting. The food is even better than I remembered and I can't wait to go back for the deep fried worms and crickets.
author: N A.

description: The Khai Soi was flavorful but just a tad little bit on the salty side.  The ginger mimosa was interesting but was expecting more for $8.  Definitely recommend if you are in the area and craving for some Thai food. Space is a bit small sized.
author: Arvind S.

description: Awesome new thai place and after coming here twice, it is officially my favorite Thai restaurant in the city. They really use fresh ingredients here and all of the dishes I had here were spot on consistent with rich flavor without the whole MSG aftertaste that you experience in so many asian restaurants in SF. Must try House duck fried rice and Ox tail soup. Worth every penny.
author: Al L.

description:
Great place for a group!
All the dishes were delicious and the service was prompt.
Reasonable price as well
author: Eric H.

description: As I stayed near nobhill for three days, I visited here twice for my dinner. The service and food were very good! I ordered green curry, pod thai, Thom yam soup and ginger mimosa. Those were all good! I definately recommend this place!
author: Doran L.

description:
Been going to this place for almost 3 years now, when it was still Chai-yo. I was worried about the quality when it became Ben Thai, however, it continued to be the same exact quality...until about a month ago. 

Don't get me wrong, this is sill the best Thai food in the area but the food tastes different, not sure what changed. Food is a little more oily and my biggest complaint is that the the level of spice is very inconsistent. Just this week, I ordered take out 3 times. The first two times, I ordered "Very spicy" and it wasn't spicy at all! Even my bf, who can't really handle spice, thought it wasn't. Today, I ordered just "Spicy" since I was sharing with him and my mouth is on fire! 

I will not stop ordering from here but hope they make a few changes.
author: Roopa A.

description: I absolutely loved my experience at Ben Thai Cafe! The wait staff were super nice, and were very attentive during my dining experience. The food was spot on authentic tasting Thai food! The pad see ew was so delicious. So many Thai restaurants will add too much oil with this dish, and that was NOT the case with Ben Thai! My date ordered the BBQ pork which was SOOO yummy! Perfect balance of sweet and savory. I highly recommend Ben Thai, and am super excited to go back there to try more of their amazing dishes.
author: Vanessa C.

description: Pad Thai was really good, but the Pad-Ta-Lay was NOT good at all. Very greasy and, considering the price, did not include much seafood. Also, I ordered my food to go and there were no napkins/utensils included. While I get that would be standard fanfare for people taking it home, I'm from out of town and took it back to a hotel room. They should have, at the very least, asked if I needed utensils, or have some placed out by the register for people to grab on their way out.
author: Shareef Y.

description: Delicious yellow curry with veggies while on lunch from work. Small, relaxing, friendly service, worth the cash.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Good food, great service, no wait, no complaints! We liked it so much the 1st time, we went back again the following night and tried some other items off the menu. Don't let the name fool you, they serve great authentic Thai dishes. We have been searching for Thai Restaurants that serve Khao Soi, a traditional Northern Thailand dish, ever since we tasted it in Chiang Mai. Ben Thai's Khao Soi hit this on the mark and all the other dishes we sampled were equally tasty. Make sure you also try the BBQ pork when you're there. Ben Thai is officially in our rotation for go to Thai food in the city.
author: Rachel E.

description: In a word: outstanding. The yellow curry had some of the best flavor I've ever had. The Pad Thai was also delicious. They have a nice mix of Thai and Chinese food here but we stuck to the Thai stuff. We also tried the corn fritters as an appetizer - not exactly a Thai specialty but they were pretty good. The beer selection is kind of lame, but not so bad that I would even remove a half star. Give this place a shot.
author: Andrew D.

description: Pad Kee Mao (fat noodles) with vegetables was awesome. The curry was awesome too. Nice, quick service. Cute little place. Great for vegetarians.
author: Raj S.

description:
Lovely little restaurant situated on a corner on Polk St. The ambiance is a perfect balance of warm/familiar and upscale/classy. From the Christmas string lights to the authentic dragon painting on the wall, I appreciated every tiny detail of this place. The staff is attentive and friendly, never letting our water cups go half empty. 

We decided to dine family style so we could sample multiple plates. Here was our menu:
1. Golden Bags: Sort of like bag shaped egg-rolls filled with potatoes and other goodies! Extremely delicious especially with the sweet and sour sauce it was served with.
2. Tom Yum: Honestly this was the best tom yum I've ever tasted! It was tangy and warm and sweet and even had a slight kick to it! 1 bowl was not enough.
3. Pad Kee Mow: One of my favorite Thai dishes, executed to perfection.
4. Pad Thai: Standard pad thai!
5. Roasted Duck Curry: I couldn't get enough of this dish. The duck was so flavorful and succulent, and the curry itself was addicting! I poured it all over my rice. Probably my favorite dish of the night.
6. Spicy Tilapia: I don't usually like fish, but this was pretty good.
7. Crab Pancake: Loved this! Sadly each person only got a small slice since there were 6 of us, but it left me yearning for more!
8. Murder Wings: Chef's special! Never tried anything like it. The chicken quality was superb, the sauce on the wings is sort of a lemongrass flavor that just felt like heaven on my palate. I don't know how I was still eating at this point, but I guess my stomach opened up another compartment.
9. Fried Banana with Buko Ice Cream: First time having buko ice cream and it was great, but the star of the dessert were those deep fried bananas! One of my friends said he didn't like fried bananas before we ordered it, but he ended up having 2 pieces! 

Overall, a wonderful experience. Compliments to the chef!
author: Michelle N.

description: Had a previous bad delivery experience with Ben Thai and ended up giving it two stars; was pretty disappointed with the quality of food but didn't know whether it was because of the delivery service or not. We gave Ben Thai an in-person try, and I'm glad that we did. We were frequents of the previous owner (when it was Chai-Yo). We ordered the same entree in-person that we did through delivery (pad kee mow) and it was significantly better. The noodles were cooked well, great flavor, just the right amount of oil and spice. ALso ordered the pik-king with tofu. The flavor was good and we liked the touch of lemongrass and the spicy sauce; the dish was undercooked though, as the green beans, broccoli, and carrots were not as soft as would be expected. Overall, glad that we went to try the restaurant in-person and we would come again. Though we still don't plan on ordering delivery again though.
author: Will H.

description: Best thai food I've had in the area - up there with Lers Ros. The best thing about this place is the adorable and relaxing atmosphere...great for a date or a chill dinner with a friend. The service was really great, too. Will definitely be back!
author: Lindsay Y.

description: A great fresh Thai place with friendly staff and a simple refreshing menu. Service always prompt and takeaway always made and packaged with care.
author: Scott W.

description: We felt very rushed while eating here. The place was very busy and seemed a little shabby. We aren't sure how two starters, two mains, and two small beers cost $80 plus tip, so I'd say the place can be very expensive. Choose your meal wisely. That being said, the food was nice, but the portion size was maybe a little too large.
author: Chris H.

description:
Allow me to join the chorus of voices approving of this new Thai restaurant on Polk between Pine and Bush.  I came here for the first time a few months ago, and boy was I glad I stopped in.  

In short, I haven't had Thai food this good since I was in Thailand.  In fact, I didn't eat much Thai food at all after visiting Thailand because it was always such a disappointment.  This place, however, delivers.  All the staples are well executed and spot on - tom yum, tom sum, pad thai, pad see ew.  Add to that many of their specialty dishes (duck noodle soup, OMG) and this place is unstoppable.

I would recommend any fan of Thai food to come here and enjoy.
author: Kyle M.

description: Went for lunch here today with a friend and we started with the Murder Wings, and then split the Pad Kee Maw and Yellow Curry.  I've never had chicken wings quite so zesty and fragrant.  While it was all good, my favorite was the Pad Kee Maw.  Service was also spot on, they refilled my water super fast multiple times.  Great new gem on Polk St!
author: Mr I.

description: Love to go here for lunch. Fair price and great food. Great Thai restaurant. I wish they have more options for dessert. Appetizers and dishes are great and reasonably priced.
author: T L.

description: Finally, an amazingly delicious Thai spot in the neighborhood. There were so many enticing options on the menu, it was hard to decide. We went for the panang chicken curry and pad see ew, both were so flavorful and fresh. Portions were generous and presentation was great. Above all else, service was superb. I'll definitely be back to devour the rest of the menu!
author: Dara E.

description: Ginger lemonade was awesome! We tried the fired rice, murder wings, duck curry, and tilabia.  Everything's super delicious .. This place is seriously tasty.  Might become our regular spot.
author: Mazry O.

description: Came here for my boyfriend and I's 1st anniversary dinner. We chose it because we both love Thai food, it got great reviews, and we thought the heart shaped rice would be a nice touch for the occasion. The food was absolutely amazing. We got the murder wings (flavor was awesome, not too spicy), the crab pancake, tom Kha soup (not overly sweet), the yellow curry (highly recommend), khao soi (unique and amazing dish I've never had before), mango sticky rice, and friend banana & coconut ice cream (must get). We were so full and satisfied. Our waiter was very kind and attentive. He even gave us complimentary champagne when we told him it was our anniversary. This is the best Thai I've had in SF. I will definitely be back. It will be my new go to for any visitors!
author: Kelly R.

description: my favorite thai restaurant in SF. I came here once on the way to a movie at AMC, and I have been addicted ever since. Great for take out, or a nice night out. Everything I have had is delicious, but the curries are my favorite.
author: Lina S.

description: This place is great. Customer service is very good.  Good outstanding and unique. I've been twice and very happy both times.
author: James L.

description: Very good food, and I'm not big on Thai. Great service and atmosphere. I would definitely eat here again if I lived in San Francisco.
author: Taylor F.

description:
Walking down Polk street, my date and I  decided to try this place out.  Looking through the window, the decor was nice and elegant.  We walked in and were seated promptly by the server.  The placed looked very clean and the atmosphere was nice.  

On to the food,

We ordered the Murder Wings which came out nice and crispy.  The sauce was sweet and tangy with a hint of herbs and a kick.  I was kicking my fingers after the last wing. 

For entrees, we ordered the Pad Kee Mao with chicken and the Green curry with shrimp.  Both entrees tasted really good and authentic.  The shrimp and chicken were nice and juicy and showed no signs of being over cooked.  I really enjoyed that all the veggies in the dishes were fresh and tasty and complemented each other well.  The waiter was nice and always refilled our water when it was getting low.  

I recommend this place to friends or anyone in the area looking for good food.  Definitely will be coming back to Ben Thai's to try other items on the menu too.   A+
author: Johnny L.

description: Wonderful and attentive service, great food and heart shaped sticky rice :) can't go wrong here
author: Yelena K.

description: New yummy Thai food restaurant on Polk. We had the Pad Kee Mao and the spicy tilapia. Both were delicious. I especially recommend that tilapia - sooo good. The staff was super friendly and the seating is very comfy and cozy. Nice modern Thai art on the walls, too! Great friend meetup or casual dinner date spot.
author: Karen M.

description: Giving 4 just becauae yellow curry was to die for!!!!! It is overpriced though and it didnt even come with rice. Pad thai was dissapointing, but the curry....trust me on the curry :D
author: Sofia R.

description:
This is the best Thai restaurant ever! I have been to many Thai restaurants around the country but this one is really a top notch in flavor and ambiance. We ordered: Panang curry with beef, larb duck, bbq chicken, Tom Kha, Ghao Soi, and murder wings. Literally EVERYTHING was excellent. 
My most favorite is Panang Curry, it is thick and creamy with lots of favor (not like lots of places that make them in thin sauce and barely any real curry flavor). 
Murder wings- this is to die for. It's an appetizer but it's so good that I don't mind eating it as a part of my main meal. 
Tom Kha, good thickness of the soup and packed lots of flavor. 
Bbq chicken is so tender and flavorful. This is their style of bbq chicken (no regular bbq ribs sauce added here) so don't be afraid of ordering it that it might come out not authentic. 
Larb with duck was sooo refreshing and so tender. 
Lastly, Ghao Soi is a great curry noodle dish. I suggest eating this first if you order it with other dishes since it's on the thicker sauce side. 
Will definitely comeback again. Staff were excellent and courteous(so was the owner)
author: Monica V.

description: We found this Thai restaurant through the yelp app and we were very happy with the service and the food. I can recommend the Pad Thai - it was delicious! Our waiter was very attentive and kind, as was everyone else who worked at the restaurant! Bravo!
author: Lucey M.

description: Awesome Thai food, pad se ew was great, as was everything but the duck curry... my oh my!
author: Sebastian C.

description: Tasty food with lots of flavor. We were a group of 4 and tried a lot of different dishes. All were good. You will need to ask for spice if thats you desire since most food is not spicy. Alcohol menu is light but they have a variety of beer (tap and bottle).
author: Alan G.

description: Big fan of this place, the service was great, the food was very flavorful and fresh. In addition to the classic Thai dishes I expect they have some fun appetizers I hadn't seen before, we tried the corn cakes and they were great. The panang and green curries were also terrific.
author: June O.

description: Great atmosphere and environment, loved the food! We were treated with excellent service from our waitress and the appetizers were great. Murder wings had a nice kick to it and I loved the pork from heaven. Can't go wrong with the pad thai either. Left feeling full, will be back again.
author: Kevin P.

description: Outstanding food! Just had lunch in this place and had a great experience. The place is extremely small but I guess it's common for this area. The service guy is very busy trying to serve and clean everything. They probably need another person in there. However, is very nice and the food was great. I'm a seafood junky so I ordered one of their lunch specials with prawns and it was very very good. The dish came full of large prawns. Most places will just put a couple of prawns and fill the rest with vegetables but not this place. Thank you.
author: Mikey S.

description:
I ordered the chicken pad thai and it was great! Awesome flavor and the chicken was juicy and not dry like many thai restaurants. The two tables next to me told the waiter the food was great. I hope the waiter relayed the compliments to the cooks.

Very nice decor and setting.

Too bad I dont live in the area. I would definitely come back again when I'm nearby!
author: D. C.

description: Duck soup was very good as well as the Ka-ree yellow curry with chicken. Service was quick and enthusiastic and food served piping hot.
author: James C.

description: The duck noodle soup is the best thing in the city.
author: Brian S.

description: Great service for lunch. Had the peanut pra-ram with chicken. Delicious! Came with salad, steamed veggies and the most delicious peanut sauce. $12 before tax and tip. I'm coming back when in the area!
author: Genevieve R.

description: ALL of the stir-fried noodles were amazing! Hands down the best I've had at a Thai restaurant. I wish there's a location in the south bay! The service was super and all the staffs were friendly! This place is a must try!
author: Huong D.

description:
This place gets busy in the evening! I came here with a friend one weekday night at around 7 p.m., and it was still pretty empty, but by 8 p.m. there was a line of 2-3 parties waiting for tables.

The interior is nice, service is decent, and food is pretty good. I tried the murder wings (tasty) and gra-prao fried rice (also tasty). The portions were bit small for the price, but hey, SF is an expensive city.
author: Jenny Z.

description:
Ordered delivery from Ben Thai Cafe tonight not having realized when I put in the call that they switched over from Chai-Yo just 1-2 weeks ago.  Our order came more quickly than estimated (it was about 25 minutes vs. 45 quoted).  I've been severely missing Little Thai (later T2J Thai) since their landlord drove them out of business in July 2014.  I'm extremely happy to have a new Thai delivery place that is this good.  

We ordered:
Chicken yellow curry with jasmine rice
Pad Se-Ew with chicken and (regular) broccoli (it normally comes with Chinese broccoli)
Cucumber salad

All outstanding!  I'm looking forward to trying some other dishes.
author: Amy H.

description: Me and my brothers were in town for a couple days and we looked up a bunch of restaurants on Yelp. And after a lot of searching, we choose to go to Ben Thai Cafe! This is the best decision of our life! First of all they were really nice, the food came really and fast and looked amazing! We ordered 3 appetizer and they all tasted amazing!!! Then we had 3 different main courses, and they were even better! This is the best place we have eating Asian food ever! You will not regret going there!!! :)
author: Ragnhild H.

description: I had the spicy eggplant dish and a Thai iced tea. Sooo spicy! My only complaint is that the iced tea should have free refills!
author: Nikki B.

description: I requested spicy for my red curry and they gave it to me. Fantastic food and friendly service. Real thai food. You won't regret eating here.
author: Jon H.

description: Decent Thai. Make sure to ask for it hot! Flavored are complex and delicious. Alcohol selection is sub par.
author: Daya P.

description: Food and ambiance are AMAZING. Takeout is great/fast too! I highly recommend the roasted duck curry and the mango sticky rice (rice may not be on menu, but they'll make it I promise!). Seriously though, the duck curry is fantastic and flavorful. Portions are great, and I swear that the servings are even larger for to-go orders. The first time that I ever went in, the manager (owner?) personally came to my table and made us feel as if we were regular customers... Well, now I am and he still makes a point to come say hello - even if I'm grabbing a to-go order.
author: Shelby A.

description: The restaurant is wonderful. I thoroughly enjoyed my time there as one who loves Thai food. The eating space is just right. You will not be too close to other customers to make you feel uncomfortable. Pleasant ambiance surrounds you as you drink and wait for your food. A couple of neat pictures decorate the wall to add flavor but nothing too flashy. The restaurant's space, when filled with other customers, creates an enjoyable and relaxing ambiance rather than a noisy, unsettling one. Ben tai has an outstanding Gang-Dang (red) curry. It's made with high quality ingredients such as the meat of choice and the vegetables that accompany the meat. The chicken satay is also a wonderful starter dish (for those who love peanut butter sauce). All in all the time was enjoyable, the food was outstanding, the customers where complementary to the setting of the restaurant rather than a hinderance and the staff was absolutely wonderful and attentive to our needs.
author: Christian P.

description: This place was amazing! We stopped here for a light lunch and everything we tasted was absolutely delicious. I highly recommend the Chicken Satay with peanut sauce, the murder wings and Prawn rolls. The plating of each dish was professional and artistic. We were stunned that literally every single bite was so full of flavor it left us craving for more. Time constraints prevented us from ordering an actual entrée, but the next time we are in San Francisco we are making a point to return to this place!  If the appetizers are a preview to the main courses, I am confident nothing will disappoint. The atmosphere was very clean, cozy and comfortable, service was prompt and very polite. Excellent customer service. We were only the second table to arrive for lunch and by the time we left every single table was occupied. The place was packed. If your looking for simple, delicious, fabulous food, go to this place. You will leave satisfied and eager to return.
author: Nadine M.

description: Fantastic little Thai place. They serve unconventional dishes like this khao soi. Delicious noodles in curry soup.
author: Sarah P.

description: This is my new favorite Thai restaurant. The food is delicious with all of your Thai standards prepared impeccably plus some twists and different options. The staff is super friendly and the price is right too. Try the larb salad with duck and the kho soi (curry noodle soup) - so good!
author: Michael S.

description: Solid Thai restaurant that was more than decently priced for the food. Service quick and courteous.
author: Conor M.

description: Authentic home style Thai food... and did I mention the murder wings? They're b-o-m-b.
author: Legendary W.

description:
Went to this place after a friend's suggestion. It did not disappoint! I had the khao soi for the first time as I haven't seen it in other Thai restaurants I visited. The curry broth was rich and delicious. The pickled greens balance out the overall richness of the dish and definitely surprised me with that burst of acidity. The crispy noodles and pork rinds on top provide a nice contrast in texture to the soup. 

I didn't expect this place to be busy on a weekday night since it's fairly new, but the wait wasn't that long and the food makes up for it.

Thai iced tea is awesome as well. Then again, I'm biased since I'm always down for Thai iced tea.
author: Eli P.

description: Ordered Pla-Siam. So good, tasted like quality ingredients. Thai ice tea is on point. Friendly service. Make sure to be there early, seats go fast. Next time I'm going to save room for dessert... FBI!!
author: Joel G.

description:
Ordered take out. It's nice that I could order through Yelp's app and specify the time for pick up. My food was ready on time and perfectly warm.

As for the food itself, pretty good tom yum soup with tofu! I also enjoyed the green curry with beef.   Looking forward to trying more things next time!
author: Riz W.

description: Yummy food and friendly people. I'll be back!
author: Kenzie T.

description: If you were a potato, your dream job would be to grace Ben Thai's curry.
author: Rex X.

description: We live about ten blocks away and are thrilled this spot just opened up. Very original, great service, great food - looking forward to seeing this place succeed!
author: Justin N.

description:
Overall a very nice yummy place!

For drinks, we got the ginger lemonade and thai iced coffee. I loveee ginger, so the ginger lemonade was right up my alley. I also really liked the thai iced coffee. It had a good coffee taste without being bitter or watered down! 

For food, we tried the golden bags, murder wings, and the green curry. The food was super flavorful and presented so nicely! My favorite were the two appetizers. The golden bags were so pretty! You can tell that they spent time putting it together. They were nice and crispy on the inside and warm and potatoey on the inside. The murder wings were soooo flavorful! It was full of flavor but so fresh at the same time. I highly recommend trying these! 

The place itself was very nice and clean. The staff was very friendly. I think they've put a really fun twist on Thai food, and I'll definitely be back!
author: Jennifer H.

description: Awesome food and awesome service! For those of you who are familiar with the popular Thai restaurants in SF (Marnee, Chabaa, etc.), I'd say this one gives them a run for their money. I got the green curry with chicken. It's not watered down like most other places and there was a nice kick, but nothing too strong. We also tried the crab fried rice and the pad se ew. All delicious!
author: Tiffany M.

description: I'm here right now. This place is amazing. Food is amazing. Drinks are amazing. Service is perfect. I have nothing bad to say at all. Decor is great too , if anyone cares about that. Im so happy right now.
author: Chelsea R.

description: My husband and I walked into this restaurant off the street and were blown away. This is thai food mixed with Indonesian and Chinese influences. We ordered some of the best curry we have had stateside. The ambience is cozy and casual and on a fun corner to people watch. Try it out!
author: Alison C.

description: Amazing food, nice ambiance.  The food is really well spiced. One of the best Thai places I tried. Highly recommended! Great service.
author: Iman M.

description: An incredible find! A cozy place, excellent food, and a great staff. We will be back again and again!
author: Anna S.

description:
My go to thai restaurant. 
Would recommend the noodles and currys, although I am sure the other stuff is equally good.
author: Jatin M.

description: The pad see you was yummy and the curry had a nice spicy kick. Delivery took a while though.
author: Melissa G.

description: Amazing food! Loved the Murder wings, service, beers on draft (especially at happy hour) and the tofu veggie Pad Thai (ask for spicy.) will return great new restaurant!
author: Jake M.

description: I can't believe I haven't reviewed this gem yet! I used to work around the corner and would come here about once a week. If I could, I'd eat there everyday. I like this spot because the service is very friendly, the quality of the food is great, and they have both the typical AmericanThai food menu items AND some less common items that  are more traditional and we don't get exposed to here. I'm really glad that this spot has allowed me to expand my Thai-food-horizon. I love the usual stuff--green curry, parang curry, chicken satay, Pad Thai-- all great. But the thing that REALLY BLEW MY TASTE BUDS was the **KHAO SOI**. This thick and flavorful soup rivals ramen for me. It's a burst of textures and noodles and creamy broth and pickled veggies that haunt me in my dreams...in a good way. Highly recommend this spot! Definitely a great spot to have dinner before a night of bar hopping on Polk!
author: Shayan S.

description: Horrible delivery service. The food never arrived, I ordered 3 items, for a total 50 dollars. Oh they ask for the tip when you pay on line. Then when I call asking for my food the placed my on hold for long time
author: Francisco M.

description: Love this place!  I was literally thaied up! To start I had the Tom Kha soup with beef which had just right amount of spiciness and coconut flavor, then the Gra Prao (chicken) which was perfect and accompanied with a Thai iced tea which had just right amount of sweetness lastly topped off with some fried plantains and coconut ice cream for dessert! Couldn't go wrong with any of it Food, service, ambience etc.
author: Chris T.

description: We had the murder wings, pra ram tofu, and Khao Soi. The sauce for the murder wings were tasty with bits of ginger and spices. The wings were a little overcooked, but the everything else was super great. The Khao Soi was super flavorful, my dad soaked his rice in it. Definitely will come back!
author: Scooter C.

description: Great flavor! Best chicken larb & fried rice ev.er :) plus great customer service and ambiance
author: Eileen N.

description: This is solid Thai food. As in most Thai restaurants they each have a little of their own twist. Their twist is really good.  Good portions and priced well for the city.  I would go back in a minute.
author: Doug D.

description: Had dinner with my son here last night. Very nice little Tai restaurant. Good presentation and prices. Menu with lots of choices. Fresh. Beer on tap and excellent ginger lemonade (N/Alcohol) highly recommend golden bags (like a samosa) and murder wings! Not too spicy and so flavorful. Son had crab pancake and said it was wonderful! Going to visit again.
author: Liz T.

description: Really delicious Thai food!!!!!! Genuine service and clean atmosphere! Tarin, one of the chefs, is really talented and skilled in cooking! He came out to our table and talked to us - very friendly family owned restaurant. I can't wait to come back! :)
author: Penelope L.

description: Loved my lunch at Ben Thai. We tried the Spicy Eggplant with Basil and Keow-wan, as well as the Som Tum. Each dish was fresh and flavorful, balanced perfectly between sweet/spicy/salty. A great addition to the Polk Street restaurant renaissance. I'll definitely make it a go to spot.
author: Gigi B.

description: Solid but nothing spectacular. The Green Curry was solid and is worth a try, the Pad Thai is ok but doesn't stand out, and the fried rice is bland and you should probably order something else.
author: Matt P.

description: I loved this place. Prompt service, fantastic food and healthy portions. The restaurant atmosphere is OK, but proximity to other Polk Street activities make this a real gem. Had the pad thai, green curry and red curry in our party - everyone was very happy with their food.
author: Jacob L.

description: This is hands down my favorite Thai place. I don't live in San Francisco, but visit frequently and this place has become a staple of my trips. I love Thai food and have passable Thai in my city, but this place is what I crave when thinking Thai. At this point I've tried most of the menu and nothing has disappointed. Favorites: pork of the heavens, Tom kha (soup, I get it with chicken - and I get it every time, soooo good), and the ka-ree (yellow curry). They'll also do what they can to accommodate your special needs - for example: when headed to UCSFMC to visit a friend going through chemo I wanted my Thai fix, but I also needed something easy and tasty for him. I explained what I was looking for and they fixed me up with beautifully juicy, mildly seasoned chicken and rice. Perfect. The place is owned and run by a local family, and you can tell how much they care about both their food and their customers. Highly recommended!
author: J L.
